12:15.race_name: Enquire About The Cheltenham Bloodstock Club Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Never landed a blow when an outsider over 2m1f here on seasonal debut
runners.name: Cant Resist It
runners.spotlight: Has bits of placed form but he never landed a blow when an outsider at Cheltenham (2m1f) on seasonal debut; this longer trip needs to prompt improvement.

runners.comment: Purchased for £55,000 since finishing third in Irish point
runners.name: Handin Manypockets
runners.spotlight: Purchased for £55,000 since finishing third in Irish point; starts off his rules career in waters that may prove too warm.

runners.comment: Showing consistency; latest effort has been franked; remains of interest
runners.name: Just Golden
runners.owner: The Late John Hales And Miss L Hales
runners.spotlight: Beaten favourite on three occasions but form figures of 2123 demonstrate consistency; gained the win in bumper; Newcastle hurdles effort (2m6f, good to soft) last time has been franked; remains of interest.

runners.comment: Showed up well for a long way at Newbury on the switch to hurdles
runners.name: Kiwi Rush
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in series final at Kelso on final bumper start (won there the time before); showed up well for a long way at Newbury (2m4f, soft) on the switch to hurdles; one of the main form contenders.

runners.comment: Sold for £45,000 since off the mark at the third attempt in Irish points
runners.name: Minella Mission
runners.spotlight: Raced three times in Irish points, winning the final attempt; subsequently sold for £45,000; the betting may offer further guidance as regards this rules debutant.

runners.comment: Sold for £105,000 since Irish point win; the pick of the rules debutants
runners.name: Neon Dream
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism (by 4l) in second attempt in Irish points; subsequently sold for £105,000 at the Tattersalls Cheltenham Festival Sale; the pick of the rules debutants and market support would heighten interest.

runners.comment: Has solid placed form, latest switched to hurdles; firmly in the mix
runners.name: Step Ahead
runners.spotlight: Solid placed form in bumpers (including Listed) for previous yard; another sound effort, beating all bar the market leader, at Warwick (2m5f, good to soft) switched to hurdles; firmly in the mix.

runners.comment: Both hurdles efforts suggest he'll be more interesting in handicaps
runners.name: Walk Tall
runners.spotlight: Winner of Irish point and second in a bumper; however, both attempts over hurdles suggest he'll be more interesting in handicaps shortly.

12:50.race_name: Ellenborough Park Hotel 'Chasing Excellence' Novices' Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Useful hurdler who won on chase debut at Thurles in November; respected under penalty
runners.name: Eagle Fang
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner who was placed in a Grade 2 at Navan (2m4f, yielding) last season; weak 7-1 shot on chase debut at Thurles (2m6f, yielding) in November but he was always prominent and kept on well to beat the favourite; that was a bright start in this sphere and he ran right up to his best with that brave win; respected under penalty.

runners.comment: Won a Newbury handicap last month but this is much tougher and he has plenty to find
runners.name: Knight Of Allen
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner who made it second-time lucky over fences when landing a Newbury handicap (2m4f, good to soft) last month; hit a personal best with that success but this is much tougher back in a novice and he has plenty to find on the figures.

runners.comment: Smart hurdler who won in good style over fences at Wincanton last month; strong contender
runners.name: Regents Stroll
runners.spotlight: Close second in the Grade 1 Mersey Novices' Hurdle at Aintree (2m4f, good) in April, and with this hood back on he settled better than on his chase debut and jumped well to win a match at Wincanton (2m4f, soft) two weeks ago; that was a comfortable win against a useful rival and this scopey 7yo could have a very bright future over fences; strong contender.

runners.comment: Listed hurdle winner who may have needed the run over C&D on recent chase debut; dangerous
runners.name: Califet En Vol
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-4 over hurdles and his last win was in a Listed race at Huntingdon (2m3f, good to soft); well-held second of three on chase debut over C&D last month but a mistake two out didn't help and he shaped as though he needed the run; remains an exciting recruit to chasing and he receives weight from three of his rivals in this contest.

runners.comment: Good hurdler but he's been disappointing in two chase runs this autumn; something to prove
runners.name: Miami Magic
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-2 over hurdles with novice win at Kempton (2m, good to soft) last November and runner-up in Graded races on next two runs; however, didn't jump with fluency when well beaten on October's chase debut at Uttoxeter and he finished a well-held third again in another small-field event at Kempton (2m2f, good) last time; has something to prove and this looks a tough assignment.

runners.comment: Scored easily at Haydock on reappearance; 4-10 at Cheltenham; may remain competitive
runners.name: Does He Know
runners.spotlight: Veteran who scored easily at Haydock (3m1f, good to soft) on reappearance and may remain competitive despite going back up the weights; record of 4-10 at Cheltenham includes a win off 5lb higher in 2022.

runners.comment: Irish 8yo who may raise his game with Sean Bowen booked; heed the market signals
runners.name: Shannon Royale
runners.spotlight: Irish 8yo who needs to improve on his two efforts (hurdle/chase) this season for new yard but may raise his game with Sean Bowen booked; market support would heighten interest.

runners.comment: Shaped well at Cheltenham in last two outings; threatening to win a race of this nature
runners.name: Herakles Westwood
runners.spotlight: Second-season chaser who has shaped well at Cheltenham in last two outings, good fourth from out of the weights latest (3m2f, good to soft; joint-favourite); threatening to land a race of this nature.

runners.comment: Form in major handicaps includes a win last February and respectable effort latest start
runners.name: Katate Dori
runners.spotlight: Second-season chaser whose form in major handicaps features an impressive win at Kempton (3m, good to soft) last February and respectable sixth at Newbury (3m2f) latest start; major player at this level.

runners.comment: Contrasting efforts over the National fences at Aintree this term; not sure what to expect
runners.name: Excello
runners.spotlight: Contrasting efforts over the National fences at Aintree this term, running creditably in the Grand Sefton (2m5f) then poorly in the Becher (3m2f); not sure what to expect and his losing run is mounting up.

runners.comment: Well treated on best form, including second off 8lb higher in this race two years ago
runners.name: Inch House
runners.spotlight: Far from solid on his form (PP6P) for current stable but registered the completion at Cheltenham and remains well treated on best figures, including a second-place finish off 8lb higher in this race two years ago.

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie La Grugerie
runners.comment: Disappointing last time but otherwise a largely productive sort; not written off
runners.name: Jasmin De Grugy
runners.spotlight: Disappointing favourite in notable handicap at Newcastle (2m7f) last time but otherwise a largely productive sort over hurdles and fences; may still have more to offer in this sphere and remains of interest.

runners.comment: Record of 1152 in hood; might have won at Sandown last time but for jumping left
runners.name: New Order
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-7 since switched to chasing and form figures of 1152 since wearing a hood; might have won at Sandown (3m, good to soft; beaten only narrowly) last time but for jumping left; possibilities.

14:00.race_name: Betfair Exchange Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Record of 3-3 for Willie Mullins then 2-5 for Henry de Bromhead; drops back in class
runners.name: Jungle Boogie
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 12yo; record of 3-3 for Willie Mullins then 2-5 for Henry de Bromhead; one of the first beaten in the Ryanair over C&D on last appearance but returns to calmer waters on handicap/stable debut.

runners.comment: Very useful 2m chaser on his day; something to prove back up in distance
runners.name: Matata
runners.spotlight: Very useful 2m chaser on his day and is 1lb below last winning mark; hasn't found his peak form this season, however, and this step back up in distance leaves him with something to prove.

runners.comment: Made all for 10l success at Newbury, taking record this term to 2-2; better than ever
runners.name: Twinjets
runners.spotlight: Made all for 10l success at Newbury (2m4f, good to soft) last time, taking chase strike-rate to 3-8 and record this season to 2-2; climbing the weights but warrants respect in current form (better than ever).

runners.comment: New mark has kicked in but this drop back in trip is a plus; has won over C&D
runners.name: Riskintheground
runners.spotlight: Record of 7-22 over fences includes a C&D success in April; non-stayer in major handicap over 3m2f last time when ahead of the assessor; new mark has kicked in but the drop back in trip is a plus.

runners.comment: Has several pieces of good form over C&D, including two wins; on a handy mark
runners.name: Il Ridoto
runners.spotlight: Has several pieces of good 2m4f form at Cheltenham, including two wins; has proved a weaker finisher here in last two outings but holds a fighting chance off current mark provided he's back to best.

runners.comment: Has bits of C&D form, notably close second to Moon d'Orange last January
runners.name: Grandeur Dame
runners.spotlight: Record of 4-17 over fences; beaten long way in major 3m2f handicap at Newbury most recently; has bits of C&D form, notably close second to Moon d'Orange off 2lb higher last January; not dismissed.

runners.breeder: Earl Elevage Marion & Mr Didier Marion
runners.comment: Return to this scenario may have positive effect; gained sole chase win over C&D
runners.name: Moon Dorange
runners.spotlight: Gained sole chase success in similar event over C&D (off 4lb lower; soft) last January when overcoming a bad late error; inconsistent since but the return to this scenario may have positive effect.

runners.comment: Made all in the December Gold Cup over C&D last month; major player off 3lb higher
runners.name: Glengouly
runners.spotlight: Made all in the December Gold Cup over C&D (good to soft) last month, belying his market position (rank outsider) and ending a long losing spell; major player off 3lb higher, especially if again able to dictate.

runners.breeder: M Collet, J Collet & M Collet
runners.comment: Two from two this term; out of weights upped in class but is open to further progress
runners.name: Just Over Land
runners.spotlight: Two from two this season, the latest win at Chepstow (2m3f, good to soft); 10lb out of weights upped in class but Benjamin Macey takes off 7lb; open to further improvement over fences and may emulate the similarly progressive Thistle Ask who landed this season's Haldon Gold Cup from out of the handicap.

runners.comment: Largely sound record over hurdles at Cheltenham; second in this race last year
runners.name: Gowel Road
runners.spotlight: Largely sound record over hurdles at Cheltenham includes a second-place finish in this contest last year and success in the Cleeve next time; well held over fences here most recently but looks likely to give his running returned to this sphere.

runners.breeder: E Aubree & Mrs J Goffin Van Aken
runners.comment: Successful in this contest 12 months ago; major contender returned to hurdles
runners.name: Lucky Place
runners.owner: Mrs G Van Geest & M George
runners.spotlight: Turned over at short odds in two chase attempts this term; very useful over hurdles and his progressive spell culminated in a success in this race 12 months ago, completing a Grade 2 double (good/soft) in the process; major player back in this sphere.

runners.breeder: Mrs J Rainer, Mr F Jereczek & Mr Rainer
runners.comment: Grade 2 winner over fences last term; possibly needed his reappearance run
runners.name: Jingko Blue
runners.spotlight: Rules record is 4-8; brief spell over fences last winter featured a Grade 2 win at Windsor (unseated rider final outing); came up short in Haydock handicap returned hurdles on reappearance but may fare better with the outing under his belt.

runners.comment: Impressive in Haydock handicap on stable/seasonal debut; strongly respected
runners.name: Kabral Du Mathan
runners.spotlight: Reached a useful standard at about 2m for Paul Nicholls; took his form to an even higher level and strike-rate to 4-7 when upped to 2m3f in Haydock handicap (good to soft) on stable/seasonal debut, scoring impressively and entering the Stayers' Hurdle picture (likely to stay further still); new rating puts him top in this field; strongly respected.

runners.comment: Has the worst chance at the weights on this return to hurdles
runners.name: Kamsinas
runners.spotlight: Similar type to Lucky Place in that he returns to hurdles after two chase defeats this season (admittedly went close on first occasion); successful in Grade 2 as a novice but, in terms of ratings, has the worst chance at the weights in this field.

runners.comment: Hurdles form remains inferior to his best achievements over fences
runners.name: The Real Whacker
runners.spotlight: Pestered up front and eventually dropped away last time when bidding for a second win in the Charlie Hall Chase; beaten at Perth in most recent hurdles attempt and his form in this sphere remains inferior to his best achievements over fences.

15:10.race_name: Best Odds On The Betfair Exchange Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Pulled up on two of his last four starts, mixed in with some very solid results
runners.name: Harbour Lake
runners.spotlight: Pulled up at the Cheltenham Festival in March (bled from the nose) and when 33-1 in hot race at Haydock last month, which was followed by wind surgery; those are mixed in with some very solid results, for instance when second here in April and winning a good prize at Haydock in May, but he's also now looking handicapped up to his best.

runners.comment: Comfortably won 17-runner race here (3m, good) in October; Haydock flop four weeks later
runners.name: Ma Shantou
runners.spotlight: Comfortably landed a gamble in 17-runner handicap at Cheltenham (3m, good) in October but tailed-off favourite off this 9lb higher mark in a hot race at Haydock four weeks later; needs to resume progress.

runners.comment: Good third here on chase debut in October but the fences have got in the way since
runners.name: Double Powerful
runners.spotlight: Six hurdle wins in 2024 (the latest at Cheltenham) and best hurdles form when upped to 3m at Aintree last April; another good third here (2m4f) on chase debut in October saw a rise in his mark but the fences have got in the way since, which sees him back over hurdles today; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Won a maiden here; progressive in handicaps, in hot race at Haydock latest; major player
runners.name: Ace Of Spades
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden here on good in 2024; progressive in handicaps, winning at Aintree (2m4f) in October and fourth of 17 off this mark on return to 3m in a hot race at Haydock (again good to soft) in November; major player.

runners.comment: Bang there again over C&D three weeks ago, both under Benjamin Macey; respected
runners.name: Spike Jones
runners.spotlight: Beaten a nose at Lingfield (2m7f, good to soft) and bang there again over C&D (good to soft; just ahead of Pike Road) three weeks ago, both under Benjamin Macey; creeping back up the weights but needs plenty of respect.

runners.comment: Usually front-runs; better than ever for Chepstow win latest; more to prove on good ground
runners.name: Love Of Neymore
runners.spotlight: Usually front-runs; solid in her three races last winter and better than ever when always prominent to win by a neck at Chepstow (extended 2m7f) last month; 5lb rise looks okay and this trip should be fine but there is a bit more for her to prove when the ground is not softer than good.

runners.comment: Close fourth over C&D latest, just behind Spike Jones, but 2lb out of the handicap today
runners.name: Pike Road
runners.spotlight: Usually ridden by Freddie Keighley in 2025; some jumping problems over fences before he won a hurdle race at Uttoxeter (extended 2m7f, soft; fine on good) in November; close fourth over C&D three weeks ago, just behind Spike Jones, but he is 2lb out of the handicap this time.

15:40.race_name: 18-24 Get Your Racepass 'Junior' National Hunt Flat Race (Standard Open NH Flat Race) (Listed) (GBB)

runners.comment: Got up in the final strides to beat some of today's rivals at Wincanton
runners.name: Baillys Comet
runners.spotlight: Got up in the final strides to beat some of today's rivals at Wincanton (1m7f, good) and is bred to improve plenty on that bare form, being a half-brother to very smart Romeo Coolio.

runners.comment: Ties in with Molly's Lad on Aintree running; progress is plausible
runners.name: Berkshire Woody
runners.owner: Berkshire Parts & Panels Ltd No1 Fanclub
runners.spotlight: Easy to back but showed promise with staying-on third, one place behind Molly's Lad, at Aintree (2m1f, good to soft); progress is plausible, especially if the market signals go the other way.

runners.comment: Only a neck behind stablemate Bailly's Comet at Wincanton
runners.name: Champ Kabai
runners.spotlight: Only a neck behind shorter-priced stablemate Bailly's Comet at Wincanton (1m7f, good) and can't be totally dismissed on bare form, albeit that rival may have the greater potential.

runners.comment: Not certain to confirm Ludlow placings with Faithful Guardian
runners.name: Crack Ops
runners.spotlight: Has shown his form on sharp/flat, right-handed tracks, beating Faithful Guardian by half a length at Ludlow (2m, good) latest; unexposed but this is a stiffer test in more ways than one.

runners.comment: Lost chance on the final bend in Wincanton race won by Bailly's Comet
runners.name: Crest Of Arms
runners.spotlight: Lost his chance on the final bend (proved unrideable and dropped to last then stayed on) in the Wincanton race won by stablemate Bailly's Comet; may improve at this left-handed track.

runners.comment: Ran encouragingly at Exeter but this is a much deeper contest
runners.name: Dont Rein Me In
runners.spotlight: Ran encouragingly at Exeter (1m5f, good to form) where he beat all bar a subsequent hurdles scorer; the form behind has less substance, however, and this is a much deeper contest.

runners.comment: Open to progress and may reverse Ludlow placings with Crack Ops
runners.name: Faithful Guardian
runners.spotlight: Finished only half a length behind Crack Ops, who had the benefit of experience, at Ludlow (2m, good); may progress and reverse the placings with the outing under his belt.

runners.breeder: Ecurie De Cachene, Mr Patrick Charel
runners.comment: 87,000euros 2yo; Stable Tour comment suggests he has major potential
runners.name: Garrincha
runners.spotlight: 87,000euros 2yo; brother to useful 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase winner Madara, out of French 1m2f scorer (RPR 84); Stable Tour comment suggests he has plenty of potential; interesting newcomer.

runners.comment: 22,000euros yearling; has a bumper winner on dam's side
runners.name: Ivor Bear
runners.spotlight: 22,000euros yearling; dam point and 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase winner, half-sister to bumper and useful 2m-2m5f chase scorer Castle Oliver; heed the market signals.

runners.comment: Has a useful bumper scorer on dam's side; check the betting
runners.name: Maestrow
runners.spotlight: First foal of point-winning half-sister to three winners, notably Have You Seen Me (useful bumper and 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase), from family of high-class chaser Nick Dundee; check the betting.

runners.comment: Close second in French Flat race; has joined Nicky Henderson; respected
runners.name: Mariole
runners.spotlight: Related to several French jumps winners; close second in Flat event at Lignieres (1m4f, very soft) in sole start in France; has joined Nicky Henderson and warrants respect, particularly if strong in the betting.

runners.comment: Promising second at Aintree and should be capable of progress; player
runners.name: Mollys Lad
runners.spotlight: First foal of a fairly useful jumps winner for his owners; duly showed promise with staying-on second at Aintree (2m1f, good to soft) and should be capable of progress; likely player.

runners.breeder: S A R L Haras Du Mont Dit Mont
runners.comment: Swallowed up at Aintree when bidding to follow up Market Rasen win
runners.name: Pureis King
runners.spotlight: Has raced in a clear lead in both starts, holding on by a neck at Market Rasen (2m, good) but totally swallowed up at Aintree; could prove a sitting duck in this big field.

runners.comment: Close third to fellow joint-favourite Bailly's Comet at Wincanton
runners.name: Roximan
runners.spotlight: Grandson of a French Grade 1 hurdle winner; close third to fellow joint-favourite Bailly's Comet at Wincanton (1m7f, good) and looks set for an interesting rematch with improvement plausible.

runners.comment: Overcome trouble to win readily at Wetherby; promising contender
runners.name: Sollys Gold
runners.spotlight: Overcame a spot of trouble to lead in the final furlong and surge clear for a ready success at Wetherby (2m, soft); promising contender who has created the biggest impression visually.

runners.comment: Placed twice in French bumpers but this looks a harder task
runners.name: Marvelous Dragones
runners.spotlight: Placed in the last two of her three attempts in French bumpers, keeping-on third at Durtal (1m6f, very soft) latest; however, probably faces a stiffer task in this field.

11:49.race_name: MPM Flooring Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Well beaten in three novice hurdles but ought to be more competitive in this lowly grade
runners.name: Delta Blues Belle
runners.owner: Noel Fehily Racing Syndicate - Delta B
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner in November 2024; well beaten in three novice hurdles this autumn and not obviously well treated for this handicap debut but represents a top stable and it won't be a surprise if she displays significant improvement.

runners.comment: Always behind on latest outing in September and now 0-8 over hurdles
runners.name: Linden Lane
runners.spotlight: Always behind on latest outing at Fontwell (2m1f, good) in September and now 0-8 over hurdles; given a chance by the handicapper but needs a much more dynamic performance today.

runners.comment: Pulled up on first two hurdle starts but last month's Southwell fourth was much better
runners.name: This Sway
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on first two hurdling starts but his huge-odds fourth at Southwell (2m, good to soft) last month was much more encouraging and further progress is possible in handicaps.

runners.comment: Showed promise in qualifying races but soundly beaten in both handicaps
runners.name: Away For The Night
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise in his qualifying races but was soundly beaten in his first two handicaps (2m3f/2m) and arrives here with quite a bit to prove; tongue-tie removed after one use.

runners.comment: Pulled up in first two handicaps but fared much better when third at Ludlow last month
runners.name: Midnight View
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in two handicaps in November but fared considerably better when third at Ludlow (2m, good to soft; no threat to easy winner) last month and enters calculations here.

runners.breeder: S A S Haras Le Gue
runners.comment: Headstrong and showed only minor promise in his qualifying races; handicap debut today
runners.name: The Padster
runners.spotlight: Headstrong and showed only minor promise in his qualifying races (2m-2m2f; ran out on second occasion); open to improvement in handicaps but others look less risky.

runners.comment: Placed in three juvenile hurdles last season but struggling in handicaps this term
runners.name: El Gavilan
runners.spotlight: Placed in three juvenile hurdles last season but well beaten in all three handicaps this term and now 0-11 over hurdles; needs addition of cheekpieces to make a big difference.

runners.comment: Found 2m3f too taxing last time; good chance if judged on earlier Ffos Las second
runners.name: Cumhacht
runners.spotlight: Reportedly found 2m3f on good to soft ground too taxing when well beaten at Doncaster three weeks ago but returned from long absence with very creditable second behind dual subsequent winner at Ffos Las (2m, soft) in October and ought to be better suited by the good ground here; good chance.

runners.comment: Would probably have preferred a stronger pace to chase when sixth at Taunton last month
runners.name: Rukaana
runners.spotlight: 0-10 over hurdles but ran well when second on the Flat in November and might have preferred a stronger pace to aim at when respectable sixth on return to hurdling at Taunton (2m, good) last month; could have a say.

runners.comment: Fair Flat racer who has made the frame in three good-ground juvenile hurdles this autumn
runners.name: Flagon Dry
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat racer who has made the frame in three good-ground juvenile hurdles this autumn; takes on older horses on this handicap debut; improvement possible.

runners.breeder: S A R L Ecuries Babsen Courses
runners.comment: Third at 40-1 two runs ago and had possible ground excuse last time but others appeal more
runners.name: Saucats
runners.spotlight: 16-race maiden; belied 40-1 odds when placed at Wincanton (1m7f, good) in November and may not have been suited by the soft ground when pulled up last time but overall profile remains unappealing.

12:24.race_name: Oliver Jorg Ties Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Wide-margin winner on hurdle debut; didn't run badly when turned over at short odds since
runners.name: Fountains Blenhein
runners.spotlight: Wide-margin winner on seasonal/hurdle debut at Fontwell (2m3f, good to soft) in October; last of three finishers when 4-11 favourite in small field at Plumpton (2m4f, good) in November but that certainly wasn't a bad run and he has another big role to play here.

runners.comment: Won run-of-the-mill 2m7f novice on rules debut but latest run was disappointing
runners.name: Ignore The Door
runners.spotlight: Joined Harry Derham after Irish point win in March and made winning start to rules career in run-of-the-mill novice at Worcester (2m7f, good) in October; needs to better that form here, though, and last month's Chepstow run was disappointing.

runners.comment: Placed in Chepstow bumper on debut in November 2024 but not seen since; market helpful
runners.name: Assertive Walk
runners.owner: Mrs P Bond, Magniers, Mrs P Shanahan
runners.spotlight: Kept on for third of 13 on bumper debut at Chepstow (good to soft) in November 2024 but not seen since and has good standard to reach on hurdling debut; market may guide.

runners.comment: Good start to rules career when second at Bangor; third of four at Uttoxeter yesterday
runners.name: Firm But Fair
runners.spotlight: Placed on Irish point debut in April (soft ground) and made pretty good start to rules career when second of five at Bangor (2m7f, soft) in November; debatable whether he ran to the same level when third of four at Uttoxeter yesterday.

runners.comment: Quickly bounced back from disappointing hurdle debut with easy win at Exeter; big player
runners.name: Pottersville
runners.spotlight: Readily won 15-runner Clonmel bumper (2m4f, good to yielding) by 8l in the spring and bounced back quickly from disappointing stable/hurdle debut when scoring easily by 24l at Exeter (2m7f, good to soft) in November; takes on males in a stronger race here but looks useful.

12:59.race_name: DJB Property Services Windsor Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Mares' Hurdle Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Just 1-10 over hurdles but gave excellent account when placed at Cheltenham last month
runners.name: Game Colours
runners.spotlight: Just 1-10 over hurdles but is largely consistent and gave excellent account when third at Cheltenham (2m4f, good to soft) last month; will be fine on the forecast faster ground here; must be considered.

runners.comment: Ran well for a long way over 3m last month and may be better suited by this shorter trip
runners.name: I Spy A Diva
runners.spotlight: Yet to match her best form since returning from long absence in April (four runs) but ran well for a long way at Southwell (3m, good to soft) last month and may be better suited by today's trip-and-ground combination.

runners.comment: Ran well on stable debut last December but absent until early unseat last month
runners.name: Ring O Roses
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish mare who seems very versatile ground-wise; ran well before fading into third on stable debut at Lingfield (2m3f, soft) just over a year ago but not seen again until early unseat last month and still has fitness to prove; hood refitted.

runners.breeder: J Dubois & Scea De La Vallee De Lorne
runners.comment: 2-7 over hurdles; tailed off in Listed race last time but enters calculations here
runners.name: Jasmine Dairy
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who ended last season with maiden win at Plumpton (2m4f, good) and followed up in Uttoxeter novice (2m, heavy) when back in action in November; tailed off in a subsequent Listed race but still enters calculations on this handicap return.

runners.breeder: A Hales, Mr & Mrs J Fry, Mr D Fitzgerald
runners.comment: Unraced on ground faster than good to soft but otherwise, has sound claims
runners.name: Looking As You Are
runners.spotlight: Chased home very progressive rival on seasonal debut at Market Rasen (2m2f, good to soft) in November and also ran well when third at Sandown (2m4f, soft) last month, albeit she was tired in the closing stages; unraced on ground quicker than good to soft but, otherwise. has sound claims.

runners.comment: Flopped on latest outing but looked very promising beforehand; handicap debut
runners.name: Easy Love
runners.spotlight: Looked quite useful in bumpers last season and, having won run-of-the-mill Fontwell maiden (2m5f, good) on hurdling debut in May, returned with creditable third at Cheltenham (3m, good) in October; flopped when warm favourite for next race but can be dangerous if back on song for handicap debut.

runners.comment: Kept on well for second at Wincanton last time and still has low mileage; likely contender
runners.name: Bobbi With An
runners.spotlight: Held off Springtime Legend to win Wincanton novice (2m5f, heavy) at start of last year and has made the frame in all three handicaps this season, most recently when keeping-on second at Wincanton (2m4f, soft) last month; also suited by good ground; likely contender.

runners.comment: Reeled in clear leader to score at Haydock last month, her first run after long absence
runners.name: Lets Go To Vegas
runners.spotlight: Returned from long absence with narrow win at Haydock (2m3f, good to soft) last month, keeping on gamely to reel in the clear leader, and is now 3-7 over hurdles; only 4lb higher here and still well handicapped on her old form.

runners.comment: Made low-ley seasonal debut last month but is open to improvement in handicaps
runners.name: Springtime Legend
runners.spotlight: Lost out only by a head to Bobbi With An I at Wincanton (2m5f, heavy; first-time hood) last January; two lesser efforts have followed but the latter (last month) came after a layoff and she remains open to improvement on this handicap debut.

runners.comment: Won Irish point and 2m hurdle; capitulated tamely once headed over fences latest
runners.name: Admiral Stewart
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who added a hurdle win at Ffos Las (2m, soft) in late 2024; had a walkover on his intended chase debut but offputting that he capitulated so tamely once headed at Southwell (2m4f, soft) in November and soon pulled up; risky after that.

runners.comment: Off the mark in minor 2m Plumpton maiden hurdle; respectable chase debut; can improve
runners.name: Norn Iron
runners.spotlight: Consistent rather than progressive over hurdles and found the ideal race in a Plumpton maiden (2m, good) last April; made just a respectable chase debut at Warwick (2m, soft) after a layoff, with the odd stutter along the way behind one on a three-timer, but a likely type who should improve.

runners.breeder: C A F R E Enniskellen Campus
runners.comment: Won maiden/novice hurdles last winter; not gone on over fences and ran moderately latest
runners.name: Bond Broker
runners.spotlight: Won maiden and novice hurdles (about 2m1f; good to soft and good) last winter but he has yet to go on over fences and found little when a remote fourth of five at Plumpton (2m1f, good) in November; needs another drop in the weights on that evidence.

runners.comment: Has form at 2m but stayed 2m5f well when hurdle winner in April; a threat now chasing
runners.name: Koukeo
runners.spotlight: Respectable bumper and hurdle form at about 2m but he saw out the stiff 2m5f well at Exeter (good) last spring when giving weight to one who won his next two starts; ended campaign on a low note last April but could well take to fences at the first attempt; a threat.

runners.comment: Not at best over hurdles for new stable this season but drops in grade for chase return
runners.name: Tax For Max
runners.spotlight: Very well handicapped on old hurdling form for Willie Mullins and won a beginners' chase for him in 2023; returned from long absence with four underwhelming hurdle runs for new stable in the autumn but drops in grade for this return to fences and has been given a wind op.

runners.comment: Dual winner last March; latest run steadied the ship after three non-completions
runners.name: Yes Day
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner last March (3m1f/3m6f); pulled up on final two starts last season and fell on reappearance outing in October but steadied the ship with a respectable run in November; suited by good ground and should cope with this drop back in trip; a possible.

runners.comment: Won over 2m on British chasing debut in October and could have more to offer over 2m4f
runners.name: Mister Cessna
runners.spotlight: Came good in Britain with novice hurdle win at end of last season and followed up with ready success in handicap chase at Uttoxeter (2m, good) in October; perhaps a shade disappointing when second of three last time but could still have untapped potential over fences and over this new trip.

runners.comment: Five wins for stable since September; 3lb well in after going close at Fakenham last week
runners.name: Shantou Lucky
runners.spotlight: Won five of his first six starts over hurdles/fences (2m4f-3m2f; visored for all) after joining James Owen in September and recovered from slight dip in form when close second at Fakenham (2m5f, soft) 11 days ago; good ground also suits and he's 3lb well in from a 2lb lower mark here; headgear switched.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De La Haie Neuve Et Al
runners.comment: Wide-margin winner in spring 2024; jumping error cooked his goose on last month's return
runners.name: Toothless
runners.spotlight: Came good over fences at fourth attempt, with wide-margin success at Plumpton (2m3f, good) in May 2024; not seen again until Wincanton last month, where he was going okay until jolting error seemed to knock the stuffing out of him; could still have more to offer.

runners.breeder: S C E A De La Vallee De Lorne
runners.comment: Good winner on chase debut; lacked fluency when only fourth last time; remains of interest
runners.name: Kalif Dairy
runners.owner: S Packham, A Austin And B Austin
runners.spotlight: Endured some seconditis over hurdles last season but was a clear winner when switched to chasing at Lingfield (2m4f, good) in November; lacked fluency and finished about 7l behind Joe Cotton when fourth at Wincanton last month but remains very much of interest; swaps cheekpieces for new blinkers.

runners.comment: Won valuable series final last March and has remained in good form since; respected
runners.name: Joe Cotton
runners.spotlight: Won valuable series final at Fontwell (2m3f, good; first-time blinkers) last March and has remained in good form since, most recently when third in first-time visor at Wincanton (2m4f, good to soft) last month; probably won't be far away.

14:50.race_name: Fitzdares New Year's Day Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Disappointed last time but posted career-best form when bagging good prize in October
runners.name: Rambo T
runners.spotlight: Needs to rebound from last month's disappointing effort at Aintree but posted career-best performance when bagging good prize at Chepstow (2m4f, good) in October and promising conditional Shane Fenelon claims 5lb here.

runners.comment: Ran big race when second on seasonal debut and is not yet filly exposed; respected
runners.name: Guard Duty
runners.spotlight: Won three times as a novice last season (once over C&D) and ran big race when second on reappearance outing at Newbury (2m4f, soft) in November; went up 5lb for that but is not yet fully exposed and should be fine on the faster ground here; might be the answer.

runners.comment: Began season with two good efforts but needs to find something extra here
runners.name: Act Of Authority
runners.spotlight: 5-15 over hurdles; began this season with two perfectly respectable runs but was behind Stream Of Stars when third at Aintree (2m4f, soft) last month and needs to find something extra here.

runners.comment: Made good progress last season but not much has gone to plan this term
runners.name: East India Express
runners.spotlight: Made good progress last season, signing off with 6l win at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) in April, but not much has gone to plan this term and others in this line-up have less to prove.

runners.comment: Won at Aintree festival in April and placed at Punchestown in May; back from a break today
runners.name: Wellington Arch
runners.spotlight: In excellent form when last seen in the spring, winning 20-runner handicap at Aintree festival (2m4f, good to soft) before very creditable third of 16 at Punchestown (2m4f, yielding); still quite lightly raced; contender if fully tuned up after break.

runners.comment: 2-3 since reverting to hurdles this season and good 7lb claimer Isabelle Ryder booked here
runners.name: Idy Wood
runners.spotlight: Won two chases last season and is 2-3 since he reverted to hurdling this term, the latter win gained at Kempton (2m5f, good) in November; 6lb higher in stronger race here but Isabelle Ryder claims a very useful 7lb; no surprise if he features.

runners.comment: Set to be placed at least before last-flight fall last month; remains very lightly raced
runners.name: Castle Carrock
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 7yo who was a promising novice last season; well beaten when making handicap debut in Greatwood at Cheltenham (2m, soft) in November but was set to be placed at least before last-flight fall at Doncaster (2m3f, good to soft) last month and may still have potential.

runners.comment: Quite lightly raced for his age and last month's clear Aintree second was career-best form
runners.name: Stream Of Stars
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is lightly raced for his age and probably posted career-best performance when clear second at Aintree (2m4f, soft) last month; also suited by good ground and James Turner claims 5lb here; can make his presence felt.

runners.comment: Second in major 3m handicap at Haydock in November; player if okay back at 2m4f
runners.name: Hartington
runners.spotlight: Made winning seasonal debut at Carlisle (2m4f, soft) in November and bettered that form when second in major handicap at Haydock (3m, good to soft) later that month; not sure to be ideally suited by the reduced emphasis on stamina here but might still be on the upgrade.

runners.comment: Won 25-runner handicap at Punchestown last April but too inconsisent to rely upon
runners.name: Thanksforthehelp
runners.spotlight: Won 25-runner handicap at Punchestown festival last April (2m3f, yielding) and remains well handicapped on older form but has very mixed record over last couple of years and made a low-key reappearance in November; hard to predict.

runners.comment: Gave good account when placed at Plumpton in November but others look more progressive
runners.name: Listentoyourheart
runners.owner: S T Racing - The Founders Syndicate
runners.spotlight: Gave good account when third (about 5l behind Stream Of Stars) at Plumpton (2m4f, good) six weeks ago but is yet to make any significant further progress since winning Listed novice hurdle in November 2024; others have more appealing profiles.

runners.comment: Lightly raced and disappointing since Grade 2 novice win in 2023; cheekpieces added here
runners.name: Minella Missile
runners.spotlight: Won Grade 2 novice hurdle at Cheltenham (2m5f, good to soft) in November 2023 but lightly raced and generally very disappointing since; needs first-time cheekpieces to provide a significant boost.

runners.comment: Won his first two handicap chases easily and could still have further improvement to come
runners.name: Fortune Dancer
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three maiden/novice hurdles last season but easily won two handicap chases (3m2f, good to soft/3m, soft) by wide margins in November; raised 24lb in total and needs to prove himself on the quicker ground here but could still have significant further improvement to come.

runners.comment: Well handicapped on hurdle form but has shaky record over fences; new headgear tried
runners.name: All Authorized
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner on good ground (2m3f/3m1f); well handicapped on that form but has shaky record over fences (four attempts) and was tailed off in first-time cheekpieces last month; tried in blinkers here; not easy to predict.

runners.comment: 26l behind Fortune Dancer when fourth on chase return in November; had recent wind op
runners.name: Flintara
runners.spotlight: Well beaten over hurdles on seasonal debut (wore cheekpieces) in November and was 26l behind Fortune Dancer when fourth on chase return at Uttoxeter (3m, soft; first-time visor) later that month; on good mark now but needs latest wind op (his third) to have made a difference.

runners.comment: 0-12 over fences and wasn't firing on all cylinders when last seen last spring
runners.name: Limetree Boy
runners.spotlight: 0-12 over fences and wasn't firing on all cylinders when last seen last spring; resumes on another career-low mark and remains very unexposed at around 3m but others have more compelling claims.

runners.comment: 2-5 over fences; beaten off lower hurdle mark last time; may still have chasing potential
runners.name: Bridget Mary
runners.spotlight: Doubled chasing tally with 10l win at Bangor (3m, good) at end of last season and was close/clear second over that C&D (good)  when returning in October; beaten at short odds off her lower hurdle mark since (cheekpieces left off, as today) but may still have potential over fences.

runners.comment: Four-time chase winner but out of form this season; headgear switched
runners.name: Felton Bellevue
runners.owner: Mrs H Munn, R E Good, B Case
runners.spotlight: Four-time chase winner; back down to a good mark now but has looked laboured on all three appearances this season and needs to respond very positively to a change of headgear today (usually wears cheekpieces).

runners.comment: Well beaten on seasonal debut but last month's run was better; on tempting mark now
runners.name: Spotty Dog
runners.spotlight: Thorough stayer who began last year with some respectable efforts and is on a tempting mark now; well beaten in November, after a layoff, but last month's Wincanton run was a bit better and he might take another step forward on the quicker ground here; headgear switched.

12:30.race_name: Virgin Bet Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Night Nurse Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Respectable Listed fourth at Aintree last time and he's a leading player under a penalty
runners.name: Scarlet Moon
runners.spotlight: Progressive on the Flat and won at Warwick (2m, good) in November on second hurdle start; respectable fourth of seven in Listed hurdle at Aintree (2m1f, soft) last time and he's a leading player under a 7lb penalty.

runners.comment: Made the frame on first two hurdle runs but flopped at Catterick last time; wind op since
runners.name: Arctic Voyage
runners.spotlight: Promise in defeat on first two hurdle starts (including over C&D on good to soft) albeit not totally convincing with his stamina; a tongue-tie returns and he's had wind surgery since being pulled up at Catterick 16 days ago (failed to settle) but has something to prove after that.

runners.comment: Disappointing favourite on hurdle debut and has to leave that run miles behind
runners.name: Ashdown Forest
runners.spotlight: Fair maiden on the Flat who was bought for 44,000gns to go hurdling; disappointing on hurdle/stable debut at Doncaster (2m, good to soft) three weeks ago when sent off favourite; wears first-time blinkers and he's probably capable of better, but has to leave that last run miles behind.

runners.comment: There was promise in his recent fifth on hurdle/stable debut at Newbury and he's respected
runners.name: Belaya River
runners.spotlight: Modest maiden on the Flat but he should have a brighter future in this code judged on his recent fifth on hurdle/stable debut at Newbury (2m, good to soft) which came in a deeper race than this; respected for good yard.

runners.comment: 0-6 on the Flat and tailed over C&D on hurdle debut; may be best watched for now
runners.name: Canavan
runners.spotlight: In good hands and he could take a step forward at some stage but he failed to progress on the Flat and was tailed off at 18-1 on hurdle debut over C&D (good to soft) in November; may be best watched for now.

runners.comment: 1m wins on last 2 Flat runs in Ireland; bought for 105,000gns; high on list on h'dle debut
runners.name: Falls Of Acharn
runners.spotlight: Won 1m maiden at Leopardstown (good) in August and followed up on handicap debut at Cork (1m, yielding); sold out of Jessica Harrington's yard for 105,000gns since; his (admittedly Flat) pedigree provides optimism he'll have the necessary stamina for this game; high on the list for top yard.

runners.comment: 28-1 when always behind on sole Flat start; a dramatic transformation is necessary
runners.name: Flagstone
runners.spotlight: 28-1 when always behind for John Joseph Murphy at Galway (7f, yielding) in July on sole Flat start; a dramatic transformation is necessary on this hurdle/stable debut.

runners.comment: Flat winner at ordinary level; soundly beaten on sole hurdle run; others preferred
runners.name: Glenridding
runners.spotlight: 1m Flat winner for the Kublers at an ordinary level (from 11 starts in that code); soundly beaten in July on sole run over hurdles; changed hands for 7,000gns in October; makes stable debut and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Tailed off in August on sole Flat start and same story when 50-1 for recent hurdle debut
runners.name: Orphan Ollie
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in August on sole Flat start and same story when 50-1 for recent hurdle debut at Doncaster (2m, good to soft).

runners.comment: 0-6 on the Flat for Jim Bolger & didn't achieve much; others have far more pressing claims
runners.name: Blondina
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on the Flat for Jim Bolger and didn't achieve much; new trainer enjoyed a productive December but others have far more pressing claims.

13:05.race_name: Livescore Bet Novices' Handicap Chase (Go North Forgive 'N Forget Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Patchy profile but has shown promise over fences & could improve for November reappearance
runners.name: Ozzy Cosmo
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo who has a patchy profile but is on a handy mark if judged on his third of five over fences at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) in February and could improve for his reappearance in November (hurdles); not ruled out.

runners.breeder: E A R L Equi-Michel 6 & T Leboucher
runners.comment: Took a step forward over hurdles recently and the switch to fences may be a good move
runners.name: Lord De Vinci
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo who took a step forward when fourth of eight over hurdles at Carlisle (2m3f, soft) recently, which was his reappearance and second handicap start; also displayed ability in points and the switch to fences may be a good move; he's one to consider.

runners.comment: Ran well for a long way before fading over 2m7f here last time; could have a big say
runners.name: Marty Mcfly
runners.spotlight: Hasn't kicked on since winning on chase debut at Hexham (2m4f, good to soft) in June but ran well for a long way here (2m7f, soft) last month before fading into fourth; could have a big say now back down in trip.

runners.comment: Going nicely when falling 5 out here on chase debut; possible player granted a clear round
runners.name: Fiveafterfour
runners.spotlight: Fell five out on chase debut here (2m7f, soft) last month which came on the back of a 604-day absence; however, she was going nicely at the time and this point and handicap hurdle winner retains potential in this sphere; could be a major player granted a clear round.

runners.comment: On a reduced mark but 0-11 over hurdles and needs to better his recent performances
runners.name: Cage Rattler
runners.spotlight: Sole win (from 28 attempts) came on the Flat in May 2024; on a handy mark on his best hurdle form but 0-11 in that sphere and he needs to better his recent performances if he's to make a winning chase debut.

runners.comment: The drop back in trip and first-time cheekpieces could help on his second chase start
runners.name: Didntgotwenty
runners.spotlight: Former pointer who showed signs of promise over hurdles, albeit went 0-7 in that sphere; faded into fifth on last month's chase debut at Ayr (3m, heavy) but attracted market support and the drop back in trip and first-time cheekpieces could help today; not discounted.

runners.comment: 0-10 over hurdles and didn't achieve much, but new trainer enjoyed a fine December
runners.name: Parish Star
runners.spotlight: Ex-Nigel Hawke mare; didn't achieve much over hurdles and returns from an absence for this chase/stable debut, but Adam Nicol enjoyed a fine December and has done well with similar stable-switchers previously; wears a first-time tongue-tie and she's not a forlorn hope.

13:40.race_name: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Hogmaneigh Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Unexposed over hurdles; has potential off this mark in view of his abundant Flat ability
runners.name: Wise Eagle
runners.spotlight: Very talented Flat stayer who is 2-4 over hurdles, the wins coming in late 2024 (1m7f/2m3f, good/good to soft; including here); didn't run badly on AW three weeks ago following a break; has potential off this hurdle mark in view of his Flat ability and has an excellent record here in that code.

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Haras Des Marais
runners.comment: Won first two handicaps and runner-up at Aintree next time; could have a big part to play
runners.name: Moonbow
runners.owner: J Fyffe And Mrs W Duffus
runners.spotlight: Made it 3-5 over hurdles, and 2-2 in handicaps, when winning at Perth (2m4f, good to soft) in September; another big run when second off this mark behind a progressive winner at Aintree (2m4f, good to soft) in October and he could have a big part to play.

runners.comment: Three wins from his last five starts; clearly on the up and he's entitled to respect
runners.name: Serious Chat
runners.spotlight: Progressive 7yo who made it three wins from his last five starts when returning to form to score at Doncaster (2m3f, soft) in November; the other wins were on good ground; clearly on the up and he's entitled to respect.

runners.comment: Won this last year and is on a handy mark but didn't shine on his two runs in autumn
runners.name: Bold Light
runners.spotlight: 9yo who is lightly raced for his age and won this last year (soft); also won at Kelso (2m5f, good to soft) in March and is now just 1lb higher; however, soundly beaten on both outings in autumn and has to raise his game.

runners.comment: C&D maiden winner in December 2024; mixed fortunes since but retains potential
runners.name: Smokeringinthedark
runners.spotlight: Won on rules debut over C&D (good to soft) in December 2024; mixed fortunes since but he was second on his handicap debut at Hexham (2m, good to soft) in May and soft ground may not have suited at Wetherby (2m5f) in November when below par; retains potential and could be a contender.

runners.comment: Won 1m7f novice hurdle last time and could have more to offer for top yard back up in trip
runners.name: Fasol
runners.owner: P J Vogt And Bryan Drew
runners.spotlight: Ran well in defeat in hotter handicaps than this last year (2m/1m7f) and he won a novice hurdle under Olive Nicholls at Wincanton (1m7f, good) in November last time; stayed well on the Flat in France and runner-up in 2m5f maiden hurdle in May 2024, and he could have more to offer for his top trainer now back up in trip; firmly in calculations.

runners.comment: Running respectably in handicaps but without threatening the winner; needs something extra
runners.name: Bel Amigo
runners.spotlight: Won three novice hurdles from the front at Carlisle (2m1f/2m3f, good to soft/good) last spring; respectable efforts in handicaps on his last three starts but hasn't threatened the winner and he needs something extra.

runners.comment: 2 wins in the autumn; below par last month but today's return to better ground could help
runners.name: Heart Above
runners.spotlight: Course winner (1m7f, good to soft) who posted two wins at Kelso (2m2f/2m5f, good/good to soft) in the autumn; this is a hotter race than he's used to and he was well beaten at Kelso last month, but today's return to better ground could help and he's not ruled out each-way.

runners.comment: 2-2 here (bumper/maiden hurdle); could improve further now upped in trip on handicap debut
runners.name: Chanonry Point
runners.spotlight: Course bumper winner who made it 2-2 at Musselburgh when making all here in November on second hurdle start (1m7f, good to soft); not obviously well treated off her opening mark but this unexposed, 3m point winner could continue to improve now upped in trip on handicap debut.

14:15.race_name: Virgin Bet Auld Reekie Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 11yo who hasn't threatened this term but he's dropped to a very dangerous mark
runners.name: Tommys Oscar
runners.spotlight: 11yo who won here twice over hurdles and is on a very dangerous mark on last season's best chase form; hasn't threatened this term but this is less competitive than Kelso last time, when he was fifth; not written off.

runners.comment: Won two handicaps last winter, including C&D; in good hands to continue to progress
runners.name: The Kalooki Kid
runners.spotlight: Won two handicaps in a row last winter, including C&D (good to soft), and reappeared with close fourth of four in Listed intermediate chase at Carlisle (2m4f, good to soft) when up against it at the weights; this second-season chaser is in good hands to continue to progress; key player.

runners.comment: Inconsistent last term but won easily over C&D in February & has good reappearance record
runners.name: Insurrection
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent last season and below par on last two outings; however, he produced a career-best performance when winning easily over C&D (good to soft) in February and on that evidence he shouldn't be stopped by today's 5lb higher mark; has a good reappearance record and he's high on the list.

runners.comment: Runner-up on both chase starts and latest form at Ascot has been franked by the winner
runners.name: Jet To Vegas
runners.spotlight: Won Grade 2 novice hurdle at Kelso (2m2f, good to soft) in March and runner-up in three-runner beginners' chases on first two starts over fences (2m4f/2m5f, soft/good), most recently at Ascot behind Thomas Mor who has since finished second in a Grade 1; could be on a handy mark.

runners.comment: Pulled up at Cheltenham last time but won in good style at Perth in April; not written off
runners.name: Inox Allen
runners.spotlight: Lacked fluency and pulled up at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) in October; something to prove after that but he won in good style at Perth (2m4f, good to soft) in April on his second chase run and it's too soon to write him off.

runners.breeder: Mrs J A Niven & Mrs D M Ewart
runners.comment: Showed spark with Kelso win in September but three lesser performances have followed
runners.name: Malystic
runners.owner: Clova Syndicate And P D Niven
runners.spotlight: 12yo who showed he retains spark when winning at Kelso (2m1f, good) in September and he's now 1lb lower; however, he hasn't been at the top of his game on his three runs since (fences/hurdles); wears a first-time visor.

runners.comment: The return to better ground could but others are more compelling in view of recent form
runners.name: Bleu Denfer
runners.spotlight: Won at Carlisle (2m4f, good) in April on final run for Stuart Crawford and the return to better ground could help on his third run for Donald McCain; however, others are more compelling in view of his last two efforts.

runners.comment: Well treated on past exploits but all his 2025 form puts him down the pecking order today
runners.name: Rexem
runners.spotlight: Won off 11lb higher over fences at Ludlow (2m4f, good) in October 2023; he's travelled from Ireland and won a claiming hurdle two starts ago, but all of his form in 2025 puts him down the pecking order today.

runners.breeder: Scea Haras Des Evees & Mr Daniel Cherdo
runners.comment: No match for the first two when third at Newcastle but the form has had a major boost
runners.name: Breizh River
runners.spotlight: No match for the first two when third at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) in November on his second stable start but that front pair have both given the form a major boost subsequently; 2lb lower today and not discounted.

14:51.race_name: Livescore Bet Handicap Hurdle (Go North Brindisi Breeze Series Qualifier)

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Cap Orne
runners.comment: Possible improver now up in trip; one of two handicap newcomers for yard
runners.name: Kool Raoul
runners.spotlight: Course bumper runner-up (good to soft) who has finished placed on all three hurdle runs (2m/2m4f); his stable's horses often improve when sent up in trip and he could be a contender; one of two handicap newcomers for yard.

runners.comment: Yet to pose a serious threat in a handicap but unexposed at this sort of trip
runners.name: Jena Doudairies
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner (soft) who won a maiden hurdle at Chepstow (2m3f, good) in March; has contested four handicaps subsequently without being able to pose a serious threat but she was reportedly unsuited by the good to soft, soft in places ground when upped to 2m7f at Chepstow last month and she remains one to be interested in for her top yard at this sort of trip.

runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late John Harrington
runners.comment: Promising third on stable debut at Kelso in November but a lesser run followed at Haydock
runners.name: Wolfspear
runners.spotlight: 10yo whose last win was in January 2024; kept on for third on yard debut at Kelso (2m5f, good to soft) in November and this trip may be within range, but has to bounce back from a lesser run at Haydock (2m3f, good to soft).

runners.comment: Runner-up in 2m/2m5f novice hurdles; bred to be suited by the longer trip on h'cap debut
runners.name: Biglesisback
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in mares' novice hurdles on last two outings (2m/2m5f, good to soft/soft); she's closely related to Pertemps Final winner Doddiethegreat so is open to improvement now up in trip; one of two handicap newcomers for the yard; on the shortlist.

runners.comment: Easily made all at Newcastle last month and an 11lb rise might not stop her
runners.name: Snowrocco
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent across light career but she left November's reappearance run miles behind to easily make all at Newcastle (2m7f, good to soft) last month; an 11lb rise might not stop her if she can confirm that latest promise.

runners.comment: Lightly raced; soft ground might not have suited last time; yard won this last year
runners.name: Rememberthename
runners.spotlight: Placed in two maiden hurdles in Ireland (2m1f/2m, good) and also showed promise when third on handicap/stable debut at Kelso (2m6f, good) in October; soft ground may not have suited there last month and it will be no surprise if he bounces back with a good run for last year's winning yard.

runners.comment: Consistent veteran; place possibilities but he's won only one of his last 22 starts
runners.name: Artic Mann
runners.spotlight: Consistent veteran who is versatile ground-wise and again ran a sound race when 4l third of seven over C&D last month; place possibilities but he's won only one of his last 22 starts.

runners.comment: Some good form over fences in the autumn; now 0-19 under rules but not ruled out each-way
runners.name: Wearelongterm
runners.owner: Dennis J Coppola & Mrs Dianne Sayer
runners.spotlight: Twice went close over fences at Kelso in the autumn (2m7f, good/good to soft) then didn't jump well when soundly beaten here (2m7f, soft); now 0-19 under rules but not ruled out each-way now back over hurdles.

15:25.race_name: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Won on handicap debut at Huntingdon and this unexposed 6yo is open to further improvement
runners.name: Mr Mcloughlan
runners.spotlight: Won two novice hurdles in a row (2m, good to soft/good) before respectable run in Cheltenham Grade 2 (2m, good to soft) in October, and back on the scoresheet on handicap debut at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft) in November; open to further improvement and he's respected up 5lb.

runners.comment: His losing run continues but he's on a reduced mark and has an appealing record here
runners.name: Afadil
runners.spotlight: 7yo who has been beaten on his last 14 starts going back to February 2024; however, he's on a reduced mark and took a step back in the right direction when third at Sandown last month; the return to Musselburgh could trigger a return to winning ways, with his form figures here reading 1312.

runners.comment: Won by nearly 5l on handicap debut over C&D and a 7lb rise may not stop him today
runners.name: City Of Diamonds
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-5 over hurdles when beating Star Of Guiting by nearly 5l to win on his handicap debut over C&D (good to soft) in November; a 7lb rise might not stop this unexposed and progressive 6yo.

runners.comment: Running well in defeat since tackling handicaps and he holds each-way claims
runners.name: Evaluation
runners.spotlight: Very useful on the Flat in his prime; he's raced seven times over hurdles and running well in defeat since tackling handicaps; each-way claims.

runners.comment: Three-time C&D winner who returns from a break on a competitive mark on stable debut
runners.name: Bashful
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner for Iain Jardine, the latest in February; below par in June on final outing for that yard but the subsequent break and change of scenery may have helped and he's on a competitive mark; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Encouraging start to hurdling career; improvement needed on h'cap debut but it's possible
runners.name: Cueros
runners.spotlight: Prolific on the Flat in Jersey and he won on his hurdle/stable debut at Newcastle (2m1f, good) in October; runner-up on next two starts (2m, soft), albeit no match for the winner; improvement needed on handicap debut but that's possible now back on better ground; Lambourn trainer won this last year.

runners.comment: Won in first-time cheekpieces at Wetherby and the runner-up has franked the form
runners.name: Chase A Fortune
runners.spotlight: In front when falling two out over fences at Kelso (2m1f, good) in October and his good form has continued back hurdling, making all in first-time cheekpieces (retained) at Wetherby (2m, soft) last time, when clear with one who has since gone one better; can make another bold bid up 5lb.

runners.comment: Well handicapped on last season's form but not at the top of his game this term
runners.name: Admiralty House
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on last season's form for Alan King and his new trainer's horses are running well; however, he hasn't been at the top of his game on either start for this yard and could do with settling better.

runners.comment: Runner-up over C&D on second stable start and could improve for that outing
runners.name: Star Of Guiting
runners.spotlight: Two junior hurdle wins for the Twiston-Davies yard last season; early unseat on stable debut in October following a break and beaten about 5l by City Of Diamonds over C&D (good to soft) last time; he could improve for that latest outing and be in the mix; trainer won this two years ago.

runners.comment: May have needed his latest outing and he was runner-up in this race 12 months ago
runners.name: Ravenscraig Castle
runners.owner: A Sinclair, I Jardine & V Renwick
runners.spotlight: He finished held in fifth over C&D (good to soft) in November but that was his first run since August and he may have needed it; runner-up in this race 12 months ago and might not be far away.

13:20.race_name: Read Meg Nicholl's Blog At betmgm.co.uk Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Three solid efforts over 7f; solid form claims if seeing out the longer trip (not assured)
runners.name: Areti
runners.spotlight: Promise in two runs at Newmarket before finding only a well-bred newcomer too strong at Kempton three weeks ago (7f); not certain to stay this far on pedigree but she holds solid form claims.

runners.comment: Dam a useful 7f AW winner (RPR 99); yard had a well-backed newcomer win here recently
runners.name: Arrivera
runners.spotlight: First foal of a 7f AW winner (including 2yo; RPR 99); stable sent out an impressive winning newcomer here two weeks ago (well backed) so she needs a market check.

runners.comment: 550,000euros yearling; dam a useful and well-related middle-distance winner; check market
runners.name: Bint Kilfrush
runners.spotlight: 550,000euros yearling; first foal of a middle-distance winner (RPR 91), herself from the family of 1m4f Group 1 winners Schiaperelli and Samum; no surprise were she to play a part on debut.

runners.comment: Better effort when third at Kempton (7f) after six months off; this demands even more
runners.name: Charming Doll
runners.spotlight: Returned from six months off to finish third of nine at Kempton three weeks ago (7f); open to further progress but it is essential.

runners.comment: 50-1 and well beaten in two runs in late 2025; minor handicaps beckon.
runners.name: Cospicua
runners.spotlight: 50-1 and well beaten in two runs in late 2025; minor handicaps beckon.

runners.comment: Promising 2nd at Kempton (1m) 80 days ago; open to improvement; solid claims
runners.name: Shebara
runners.spotlight: Smart pedigree and although she was no match for the winner on her Kempton debut 80 days ago (1m), she pulled clear of the third; that race yet to throw up a winner but her stable's newcomers tend to improve for a run and she's a leading contender.

runners.comment: 40,000gns yearling; has 2 winning siblings but other newcomers hold stronger paper claims
runners.name: Song Of The Stars
runners.spotlight: 40,000gns yearling; fifth foal;  sister to 11.4f/1m4f winner Phaedra (RPR 73), half-sister to 10.5f-1m4f winner Saracen Star (including AW/Belgium; 57); dam placed 1m4f/13.5f, sister to Group-placed 1m4f winner Travelling Man; other newcomers appear to have more compelling claims.

runners.comment: Sister to Group-placed winner Frankellina (RPR 105); appealing paper claims; non-runner
runners.name: Star Obsession
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; sister to winners Frankellina (Group-placed 1m 2yo; RPR 105; won on debut) and Mr Curiosity (11.6f-1m6f; 99); dam 1m-1m4f winner (including 2yo/Listed; 108); plenty to like on paper and she's one to take seriously; non-runner.

13:55.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Good 2nd at Kempton three weeks ago; in the mix with a repeat but more exposed than some
runners.name: Galileo Island
runners.spotlight: His only blip since his debut came when failing to see out 1m here in November; solid second at Kempton three weeks ago; more exposed than some but still likely to give a good account.

runners.comment: Good effort back up to 7f last time; should run his race but vulnerable to improvers
runners.name: Gorey Gold
runners.spotlight: Not far behind Galileo Island at Kempton, confirming his stamina for 7f in the process; highly likely to run his race but might find or two more progressive.

runners.comment: Tough task last time and his earlier win was a good effort; stamina for 7f not assured
runners.name: Generous Rascal
runners.owner: Valmont, C Rosier & Mrs J Rosier
runners.spotlight: Well backed when winning at Kempton last October (6f) and faced a tough task trying to concede 12lb to a filly with a BHA mark of 82 last time; slight question mark over his stamina for 7f (neither of his smart full siblings won over the trip but he is a half-brother to 2000 Guineas winner Chaldean (by Frankel)) but open to improvement and he is one to consider.

runners.comment: Led late when winning at Lingfield (7f) four weeks ago; gelded since; unexposed at trip
runners.name: Chale Chalo
runners.spotlight: The winner of two of his seven starts, the latest when finding plenty in a 7f nursery at Lingfield four weeks ago (cheekpieces on for the first time); gelded since; could have more to offer at this trip.

runners.comment: Off the mark for this yard when beating 3 rivals at Newcastle latest; not ruled out up 3lb
runners.name: Luminare
runners.spotlight: 5f turf win for Ollie Sangster in June; successful at the third attempt for her new stable when beating three rivals at Newcastle 16 days ago (7f); closely matched with Chale Chalo on a line through the runner-up; may yet do better.

runners.comment: Modest 6f form; up in trip and visored for handicap debut; opening mark looks tough
runners.name: Tactical Formation
runners.spotlight: Sent off joint favourite for a York maiden on last summer's debut but ended up a well-beaten fourth (6f, good to firm); no progress in two runs since and he looks on a tough mark for this handicap debut; this 360,000gns 2yo breeze-up purchase now steps up in trip with a visor fitted so improvement wouldn't be a bolt from the blue.

runners.comment: 6f win here on debut; held under penalty twice since; upped in trip for handicap debut
runners.name: Sahara Magic
runners.spotlight: Won a 6f fillies' maiden here on debut last November; struggled under a penalty since but she may prove suited by today's extra furlong now making her handicap debut.

runners.comment: Hasn't progressed from a promising debut; drops in trip in a change of headgear
runners.name: Uniter
runners.spotlight: Yet to build on the promise of his Kempton debut (1m), including when last of five on his nursery debut four weeks ago; dropped 3lb and now tried in new headgear; needs the shorter trip to have a positive effect.

14:30.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: 3-3 on AW; not fully exposed; sold for 320,000gns since latest run; fascinating contender
runners.name: Ten Pounds
runners.spotlight: Capable of smart form on turf, as when a close third in last season's Wokingham, and he took his AW record to 3-3 when readily seeing off five rivals in a Kempton conditions event last October (6f); sold out of Harry Charlton's yard for 320,000gns later that month; still has time to develop into a Pattern-race performer and it will be interesting to see how strong he is in the market after his break.

runners.comment: Smart sprint form (including AW) in 2024; absent since modest C&D run last April
runners.name: Wiltshire
runners.spotlight: Capable of smart sprint form in 2024, including on AW; only seen once in 2025 and that was a modest effort over C&D nine months ago; can go well fresh but perhaps a shade high in the weights on his return.

runners.comment: Down in the weights and capable of smart AW form in his pomp; absent five months
runners.name: Willem Twee
runners.spotlight: Has been a smart sprinter on AW in his day but he ended 2024 tamely and took a while to find his feet last year; his Newcastle third last May was a good run but he has been absent since finishing last at Wolverhampton five months ago; dangerous mark if ready to go.

runners.comment: Progressive last year; two solid runs for new yard after a break; each-way claims
runners.name: So Darn Hot
runners.spotlight: Did well last winter and carried the good work onto turf, winning at Windsor last June on his final run for Kevin Philippart De Foy; two good runs in defeat for his new stable this winter; Oisin Murphy booked and he is one to consider.

runners.comment: Easy win at Yarmouth in September but he beat a motley crew & this is much tougher up 6lb
runners.name: Caburn
runners.spotlight: Useful 2yo who returned to form to win a five-runner handicap at Yarmouth in emphatic fashion in September (6f, good to soft; cheekpieces on for the first time; second run for James Tate); while that was visually impressive, the form hasn't worked out and a 6lb rise in this considerably stronger race asks a much stiffer question; AW debut.

runners.comment: Better horse on AW now; a repeat of either of his last two AW runs would see him involved
runners.name: Fivethousandtoone
runners.spotlight: Well suited by AW and his last two runs on Tapeta saw him win a good race at Newcastle in June and finish second in a Racing League handicap at Wolverhampton one month later; absent for 103 days but has the ability to go well off this mark.

runners.comment: Yet to win a handicap but has some strong form so has every chance of going well
runners.name: Pocklington
runners.spotlight: Won his first two starts, both over 6f at Newcastle; yet to win a handicap but he ran some mighty races in defeat last year, notably at Newcastle (behind Fivethousandtoone) and Doncaster; solid return from a three-month break at Newcastle (7f) 19 days ago; should go well.

runners.comment: Conditions to suit and he is handicapped to run well; high on the shortlist
runners.name: We Never Stop
runners.spotlight: Two-time C&D winner; enjoyed the run of the race when winning the big sprint handicap on Good Friday but struggled on turf afterwards; more promise when a close fourth over C&D five weeks ago and handicapped to go well.

runners.comment: Impressed on AW debut here nine weeks ago; up 7lb and drawn wide but unexposed at 6f
runners.name: Lakers
runners.spotlight: He hasn't been with this yard long and he relished the return to sprinting when easily seeing off 12 rivals over C&D nine weeks ago (AW debut); up 7lb and drawn widest but foolish to think he isn't capable of better.

runners.comment: Came from poor position to take 2nd at Kempton latest; up 3lb but improving all the while
runners.name: Coul Angel
runners.spotlight: Progressive sprinter; failed to complete an AW hat-trick when second at Kempton two weeks ago but he flew home from a poor position and it represented another step forward; up 3lb but could still have more in the tank.

runners.comment: Not at best on last two starts but well handicapped on last year's best; lively outsider
runners.name: Purest Time
runners.spotlight: Not at his best on his last two starts but he had some strong handicap form in 2025, notably at Newcastle in August and York in October; on a dangerous mark and a big run could be forthcoming.

runners.comment: Comes here in top form and still on fair mark; can't afford to fluff the start back at 6f
runners.name: Eminency
runners.spotlight: Comes into the race having won three of his last five starts; wouldn't want to miss the break back at 6f but he still has some handicapping scope.

runners.comment: Not at her best in France last winter; makes stable debut after 328-day absence
runners.name: Rochelle
runners.spotlight: Won twice on AW early in her career before being highly tried; unplaced in three runs in France last winter; plenty to prove on stable debut after a 328-day absence.

15:05.race_name: Win 250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: Sold for 2,000gns since last seen; promising debut; betting to guide on stable/h'cap debut
runners.name: Tafah
runners.spotlight: Made a promising debut at Bath last summer (5.7f, firm; trained by David Loughnane) but no progress in two subsequent runs; sold for 2,000gns last October and gelded; betting to guide on stable debut.

runners.comment: Easy win on nursery debut but disappointed 11 days later; still has time to do better
runners.name: The Tunguska Event
runners.spotlight: Left his maiden/novice form behind him when running away with a Newcastle nursery last November (6f; blinkered first time); disappointed when odds-on for a selling nursery back at Newcastle 11 days later; still has time to do better.

runners.comment: Low-level form since handicapping; return to 6f can help but others look safer
runners.name: Tickettothestars
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all six starts and little to shout about in three nursery efforts; she would have finished closer at Wolverhampton when last seen in September (5f) with a clear run but latest 3lb drop not enough to tempt.

runners.comment: Has run respectably in three nurseries but the change of headgear needs to spark extra
runners.name: Mereside Princess
runners.spotlight: She has run respectably in her three starts in nurseries but without looking ahead of her mark; returning to 6f might help but improvement is required; change of headgear today.

runners.comment: Drops in trip and tried in headgear on his return from 134 days off; not discounted
runners.name: Maynora
runners.spotlight: Modest form in his six starts but prominent in the market on his last two starts when failing to get home over 1m and 7f; returns from 134 days off with blinkers added and back sprinting; not discounted.

runners.comment: Poor form in his three starts but bred to do much better and he's been gelded since latest
runners.name: Dartrey
runners.spotlight: Smart pedigree; sent off Evens favourite for his debut last August (6f, AW) but hung right and proved unsteerable, eventually tailed off; well beaten in two turf runs since (6f and 7f); gelded ahead of his handicap debut and the fact he is still being persevered with by his powerful stable offers hope of much better.

runners.comment: 3rd on three occasions but seemingly exposed and needs to find improvement from somewhere
runners.name: Mademoiselle Belle
runners.spotlight: Limitations seemingly exposed after eight starts; not sure where the requisite improvement is coming from today.

runners.comment: Likely improver back up to 6f and switched to a minor handicap; betting to guide
runners.name: Al Najashi
