runners.spotlight: Only modest form in three novice/maiden runs but stepping back up to 6f should suit and he is open to improvement now handicapping at a low level; one to note for market confidence.

runners.comment: Modest form for D O'Meara last summer; had wind op prior to stable/h'cap debut; unexposed
runners.name: Rogue Rebellion
runners.spotlight: Didn't offer much in three runs for David O'Meara last summer, including in a tongue tie on second and third occasion; has undergone wind surgery prior to this stable/handicap debut (same owners); betting useful.

15:44.race_name: Win 250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Good stable debut (6f) and latest effort was over 7f in a higher grade; solid claims
runners.name: Grey Horizon
runners.spotlight: Won a weak Catterick nursery in good style on final run for Richard Fahey (6f, soft); good debut for new yard when second at Newcastle a fortnight ago (6f) and when third of five at Wolverhampton on Boxing Day it was over 7f and in a much higher grade; should be no excuses back down in class.

runners.comment: Tailed off over 9.5f 12 days ago; drops in trip with a point to prove
runners.name: Ar Diddy Dum Dum
runners.spotlight: Good chance on the pick of her form for her former stable but she hasn't fired in three runs for James Owen; drops from 9.5f to 6f this time and comes with risk attached.

runners.comment: Couldn't live up to market billing on nursery debut in October; hood off now down in trip
runners.name: Inclusive
runners.spotlight: Down the field in three maiden/novice runs and it was a similar story on her nursery debut at Yarmouth last October (all runs at 7f); she was sent off favourite for that latest run and this well-related filly may yet have a bigger run in her; hood absent now dropped in trip.

runners.comment: Not easily recommended on racecourse evidence but faces a more realistic challenge today
runners.name: Missile Kode
runners.spotlight: Poor form in three novice/maiden runs in the autumn; looks on a stiff mark on that evidence but he is faced with a more realistic challenge today and better could be forthcoming.

runners.comment: Modest form in 3 quick AW runs this winter; headgear on for h'cap debut; possible improver
runners.name: Petes Diamond
runners.spotlight: Big prices and down the field in three quick runs on Tapeta this winter (5f to 7f); the combination of first-time headgear and switch to a modest handicap could see him step forwards; betting instructive.

runners.comment: Ended 2025 on the up; has to prove she stays 6f but likely she will and may do better yet
runners.name: Rosieisme Darling
runners.spotlight: Improved for the switch to nurseries late last year, finishing second at Wolverhampton before finding plenty to win at Chelmsford (both 5f); has to prove her stamina for this longer trip but on the up and a 3lb rise shouldn't be beyond her.

runners.comment: 9th time lucky when scoring at Chelmsford three weeks ago; up 4lb but should go well again
runners.name: Saeculamation
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the ninth attempt when landing a 6f nursery at Chelmsford three weeks ago; up 4lb and drawn widest but still more appealing than some.

runners.comment: Below par latest (7f, soft); some promise beforehand and Billy Loughnane booked
runners.name: Lady Lucky Vegas
runners.spotlight: Never dangerous over 7f on soft ground when last seen nine weeks ago but there had been flickers of promise beforehand; Billy Loughnane booked and she is edging down the weights; may have a bigger effort in her.

runners.comment: Third behind Saeculamation on last month's nursery debut (6f); may do better yet
runners.name: Magnificent Mel
runners.spotlight: Improved for the switch to a low-grade nursery when finishing third to Saeculamation at Chelmsford three weeks ago; would have finished closer there with a clear run and she remains capable of better.

16:15.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Smart staying form for A O'Brien; missed a year; promising here (2m) latest; trip query
runners.name: Chemistry
runners.owner: James Paul Services To Industry Ltd
runners.spotlight: Smart form for Aidan O'Brien included a Listed win at 1m6f (awarded race); two heavy defeats for new yard back from a year off but there was more fire in him on AW debut here (about 2m) last month when doing best work late; has a trip query back at 1m4f but he's on the way back.

runners.breeder: Ecurie Des Monceaux & Skymarc Farm Inc
runners.comment: Latest win over 1m3f here in early 2024; in good form over 2m; interesting back at 1m4f
runners.name: Enemy
runners.spotlight: Losing run goes back two years to a 1m3f win here, which was the last time he tackled this sort of trip on AW; in good form in 2m handicaps of late, albeit he found little when just behind Chemistry here last month; interesting to see how he copes back at 1m4f.

runners.comment: Out of depth in Listed race latest; 3-3 on AW earlier, including CD; non-runner
runners.name: Palazzo Blu
runners.spotlight: Out of depth in Listed race here in November but previously 3-3 on AW, the handicap win gained in good style over C&D; presumably disappointed connections last time as cheekpieces go on but he could resume progress; non-runner.

runners.comment: Two 1m4f wins in 2024; some fair runs in 2025 and might come on for latest run
runners.name: Assail
runners.spotlight: Won maiden on Tapeta elsewhere; two 1m4f wins in 2024, on turf and Polytrack, and has run some fair races in 2025; might come on for his latest run after a short break so not dismissed despite this looking competitive.

runners.comment: Six Tapeta wins, the latest over 1m4f/1m3f here; promising at Newcastle latest; respected
runners.name: Humble Spark
runners.spotlight: Six Tapeta wins, the most recent over 1m4f and 1m3f here last spring; just intermittent good runs since but only 1lb higher than the latest win and there were promising signs at Newcastle (1m2f) recently; respected.

runners.comment: 2-4 for this yard, over 1m6f here and 1m4f at Kempton; luckless latest; possibilities
runners.name: Another Run
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-4 for yard on AW, over 1m6f here and when coming with a wet sail at Kempton (1m4f) in October; luckless run when third of 12 in a higher grade there (2m) last month and has some handicapping scope.

runners.comment: Last won in July 2024 but close 2nd over C&D in May and weighted to win again
runners.name: Robusto
runners.spotlight: Often leads; last won in July 2024 but he's weighted to win again and went close over C&D in May; below best in two starts since returning from a break but the latest was better (without regular cheekpieces; blinkers now refitted) and another step forward is possible.

runners.comment: Two AW wins in 2024; mixed results in 2025 and well below best on turf in the autumn
runners.name: Umbria
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins in 2024, at Wolverhampton (about 1m1f) and Kempton (1m3f; made all), but mixed results since her reappearance in 2025 and well below best on turf in the autumn (first-time tongue-tie latest, retained).

runners.comment: Two Newcastle AW wins at 1m4f in 2024; won on turf last May; soundly beaten for new yard
runners.name: Something
runners.spotlight: Two front-running wins at Newcastle (AW; about 1m4f) in late 2024 and was successful on turf last May but he's been beaten too far in two runs for this yard to have much faith this time.

16:50.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Failed to build on a promising stable debut last time but wasn't well positioned
runners.name: Serengeti
runners.spotlight: Ex-Coolmore 4yo who made a good start for his new connections when second at Wolverhampton last November (7f); not seen to best effect at Chelmsford three weeks ago and may do better back on Tapeta.

runners.comment: In top form but no obvious reason why he should reverse Chelmsford placings with Blue Rc
runners.name: Two Tempting
runners.spotlight: Fine servant who arrives in top form, most recently finishing third at Chelmsford three weeks ago (1m); raced wide on that occasion but he was better positioned than Blue Rc and no obvious reason why he would turn the tables, even if enjoying a tactical advantage.

runners.comment: Low-key stable debut behind all of today's rivals three weeks ago; risky for now
runners.name: Bravais
runners.spotlight: Low-key stable debut when last of seven at Chelmsford three weeks ago; dropped 3lb and of interest on last year's Irish best but others look safer this time.

runners.comment: In front of all today's rivals when second last time; that run can be upgraded; unexposed
runners.name: Blue Rc
runners.spotlight: Progressive handicapper who had all four of today's rivals behind him when second of seven at Chelmsford three weeks ago; raced freely early on and couldn't quite peg back a more prominently ridden rival; up 1lb but we haven't seen the best of him yet.

runners.comment: Behind two of these last time but when returning from a break; better expected here
runners.name: Popmaster
runners.spotlight: Finished behind Blue Rc and Two Tempting at Chelmsford three weeks ago but ran creditably given he had been absent for 176 days; better expected.

runners.comment: Three more 6f wins in 2025 included one over C&D; no surprise if he returned to form here
runners.name: Aberama Gold
runners.spotlight: A wonderful performer over the years who has been another example of his trainer's ability to keep much-raced horses sweet; three more 6f wins in 2025 included one over C&D and it would hardly surprise if he returned to form after a low-key Wolverhampton run ten days ago.

runners.comment: Two wins and two narrow defeats in four C&D starts; looks sure to have a say
runners.name: Stanley Spencer
runners.spotlight: Rock solid over C&D, winning two from four starts and going down narrowly in the other two, including when inching closer with every stride in November; drawn wide again but looks sure to have a say.

runners.comment: Quite well treated on the pick of C&D and turf form but lesser effort on AW latest
runners.name: Secret Guest
runners.spotlight: Quite well treated on the pick of his form over C&D and on turf in the last year or so but he's needed some excuses as well, including in two of his three AW runs in the autumn; needs revival from last time.

runners.comment: Three front-running turf wins at about 7f in 2025; high in weights having rare 6f run
runners.name: Bell Shot
runners.owner: Sbk Racing & B & J Parr Racing Ltd
runners.spotlight: Three front-running turf wins at about 7f in 2025 but he paid the handicapping price and his recent efforts suggest he has plenty to prove on rare 6f run off his current mark; usually in cheekpieces, visor refitted.

runners.comment: Useful C&D form; good effort at weights in a seller here latest; thereabouts
runners.name: Prince Of Pillo
runners.spotlight: Useful type for this C&D and although he didn't shine here two starts ago he put up a good show at the weights in a seller last time; a peak effort would see him thereabouts.

runners.comment: Useful Kempton win (6f) latest; still well treated off 4lb lower than latest turf win
runners.name: Buccabay
runners.spotlight: Hampered over C&D when working up to a challenge two starts ago but he was delivered late at Kempton (6f) since to beat a useful rival in the manner of one who has more to come on sand; still 4lb lower than his latest turf win last May; solid claims.

runners.comment: Made it 3-5 in 6f AW races when Newcastle winner latest; back up 3lb; bold show expected
runners.name: Filly One
runners.spotlight: Front-runs; has a fine AW record over 6f and she made it 3-5 when holding on at Newcastle in November; was a wide-margin C&D winner last May and this test might suit even better; back up 3lb; bold show expected.

runners.comment: C&D winner; down weights after a mostly quiet 2025; lacks recent run; likely other days
runners.name: Amazonian Dream
runners.spotlight: Has dropped a fair way in the weights since winning two AW races in a row, including over C&D, at the end of 2024; hard to dismiss back here but he lacks a recent run and easier races will come up later.

runners.comment: Useful AW strike-rate; latest C&D win last April came in a lower grade; more to prove here
runners.name: Oriental Prince
runners.spotlight: Leads or races prominently; useful strike-rate on AW but his latest C&D win last April came in a much lower grade and he has more to prove back at 6f after some low-key subsequent runs at the trip.

runners.comment: Two 6f turf wins in 2025; capable of finding a race on AW but out of sorts of late
runners.name: Mr Cool
runners.spotlight: Two 6f turf wins in 2025 but 0-6 on AW; capable of finding a race on sand but out of sorts on his last two starts and needs a big turnaround.

runners.comment: Has won at 1m; should have the speed for first 6f run after recent 7f win for new yard
runners.name: Gunlock
runners.spotlight: Has won at 1m on Tapeta elsewhere and this is his first 6f run but he raced freely before getting a confident ride to win over 7f at Kempton on recent yard debut and he should have the speed for this trip; back up 3lb; good contender.

runners.comment: Good 6f Polytrack record; creditable 5f show after absence for new yard; first Tapeta run
runners.name: Nemov
runners.spotlight: Good record on Polytrack for Clive Cox included a 6f Kempton win; missed nearly all of 2025 but he ran well over an inadequate 5f on yard debut in December; should improve on that back at 6f but Tapeta is an unknown.

13:49.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Apprentice Handicap

runners.comment: 0-9 since joining this yard; down in grade but still hard to warm to
runners.name: La Rochette
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f turf winner in France in the spring of 2024, but 0-9 since joining this yard and failed to beat a rival over 6f here 13 days ago; down in grade but still hard to warm to; stable also runs Invincible Annice.

runners.comment: Made all over C&D 13 days ago; has been rated much higher in the past so respected
runners.name: Digital
runners.owner: Fine Claret Racing And Mrs R Carr
runners.spotlight: Made all to beat Little Mi Mi by just under a length in returning cheekpieces over C&D 13 days ago; has been rated much higher than this in the past so respected up 3lb.

runners.comment: Both wins have come over 5f so well worth a second look back in trip; cheekpieces on
runners.name: Last Outlaw
runners.spotlight: Beaten less than 2l when fifth of 12 over 6f here 12 days ago, but both wins have come over 5f so well worth a second look back in trip off his reduced mark; cheekpieces are given a go.

runners.comment: Recent efforts need improving upon; drops to 5f for the first time; visor on
runners.name: Prince Of Bel Lir
runners.spotlight: 7lb lower than when winning at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) just under a year ago, but recent efforts need improving up on while he drops to 5f for the first time on his 47th outing; first-time visor replaces the usual cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Four of his six wins have come over C&D; 2lb lower than for the latest in July
runners.name: Henery Hawk
runners.spotlight: Four of his six wins have come over C&D and has dropped 2lb lower than for the latest in July; finished behind Digital and Little Mi Mi here 13 days ago but capable of bouncing back, especially if getting a solid pace to aim at; stable also runs Shatin Venture.

runners.comment: Won off 3lb lower over C&D in November, but well held in all three starts back here since
runners.name: Invincible Annice
runners.spotlight: Won off 3lb lower over C&D in November, but inconsistent and has been well held in all three starts back here since; others stronger.

runners.comment: Last three wins have come over C&D; capable of playing a part if getting a strong pace
runners.name: Latin Five
runners.spotlight: Last three wins have come over C&D, the latest on his return from 81 days off last month; 3lb rise still leaves him well treated on earlier form and capable of playing a part, especially if they go hard up front.

runners.comment: C&D winner just under a year ago, but well beaten on his return here 16 days ago
runners.name: Stroxx
runners.spotlight: C&D winner just under a year ago, but has been up and down since winning at Catterick (5f, good) last April and was well beaten on his return from seven months off here 16 days ago; others preferred.

runners.comment: 0-13 and needs a bit more for last year's winning stable
runners.name: Wee Mary
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in four of her first five starts after reappearing for Rebecca Menzies in April, but well held in both starts since debuting for this yard in October (albeit caught the eye the first time); now 0-13 and needs a bit more for last year's winning stable.

runners.comment: 0-15 but runner-up in her last three starts; shouldn't be far away again
runners.name: Little Mi Mi
runners.spotlight: 0-15 but runner-up in her last three starts, the latest when beaten just under a length by Digital over C&D 13 days ago; now 3lb better off and shouldn't be far away again.

runners.breeder: Oghill House Stud & Joseph M Burke
runners.comment: 1-16; running well in handicaps lately, but a bit more is needed if he is to win one
runners.name: Shatin Venture
runners.spotlight: Sole success came in a 0-50 classified event over C&D last March; has run well to be placed in his last three handicaps here, but a bit more is needed if he is to win one.

runners.comment: Losing run of 17 and a record of 2-48 on the AW tempers enthusiasm
runners.name: Under Curfew
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is 6lb lower than when winning at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) last February, but a losing run of 17 and a record of 2-48 on the AW tempers enthusiasm.

14:24.race_name: Create Your Bet Builders At Midnite Restricted Novice Stakes (Horses In Bands B, C & D) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Hinted at promise when a debut fourth at Southwell; he can take a step forward here
runners.name: Mr Dreamseller
runners.spotlight: 14-1, hinted at promise when a debut fourth of six in 6f Southwell novice 59 days ago, leading until 2f out; can take a step forward here.

runners.comment: Shaped well when third over C&D in September; needs considering with better to come
runners.name: Polka
runners.spotlight: 7-1 and hooded, shaped well when third of four on her debut in novice over C&D in September; off since but needs considering with better to come.

runners.comment: Encouraging debut fourth at Southwell; can do better, especially now up in trip
runners.name: Riley Rocks
runners.spotlight: 5-1, encouraging fourth of eight on his debut in 5f Southwell novice 13 days ago, running on late; can do better, especially now up in trip; considered.

runners.comment: Zoustar gelding; the market can prove a good guide for this debutant
runners.name: Stromness
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns foal, 50,000gns yearling; Zoustar gelding; dam, 6f 2yo winner (RPR 79), is a half-sister to useful 7f winner Validated; the market can prove a good guide for this debutant.

runners.comment: Made a winning start in 7f Chelmsford novice; open to progress and rates a big player
runners.name: Three Non Blondes
runners.spotlight: 7-2, made a winning start in 7f novice at Chelmsford four weeks ago, always to the fore and sticking to her task well; should prove as effective over this trip and rates a big player.

runners.comment: Green when a debut seventh over C&D; capable of a fair bit better now so not ruled out
runners.name: Evolve
runners.spotlight: 9-2 and green, showed promise when a never-dangerous debut seventh of 13 in C&D maiden 13 days ago; appeals as capable of a fair bit better with that experience behind him.

runners.comment: Cut little ice in pair of 7f novices here last month; needs to take a major step forward
runners.name: Ravens View
runners.spotlight: Cut little ice in a pair of 7f novices here last month; he needs to take a major step forward.

runners.comment: Beat just one at Beverley in September where she hung badly left; hood back on now
runners.name: Elizabetty
runners.owner: The Cat And The Mag Partnership
runners.spotlight: Looked to be progressing until beating just one in 7.5f Beverley novice in September where she hung badly left; hood goes back on after a break with more needed.

runners.comment: Never a threat in a pair of C&D novices last month; lots more is needed
runners.name: Battenburg Belle
runners.spotlight: Never a threat in a pair of C&D novices last month; has plenty to find on form.

14:59.race_name: Join The Midnite Movement Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: 2-2 over C&D; may not get his own way this time, but he remains unexposed
runners.name: Antrim
runners.spotlight: Showed ability on turf but is 2-2 over this C&D, the latest success when making all on stable/handicap debut last month; 6lb higher and may not get his own way this time with Midnight Lion in opposition, but he remains unexposed.

runners.comment: Front-runner who has won eight times here, the latest 12 days ago; can't be ruled out
runners.name: Midnight Lion
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who is versatile as regards trip, having won eight times over 7f-1m2f here, the latest over 1m 12 days ago; 3lb rise puts him on a career-high mark, but he can't be ruled out if he does manage to get to the front.

runners.comment: 2lb higher than when winning over C&D 13 days ago; a contested lead would aid his cause
runners.name: Machete
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner in France who was gaining his first success for this yard when getting up late over C&D 13 days ago; just 2lb higher and although further may suit ideally, a contested lead would aid his cause; respected.

runners.comment: Record over C&D reads 412131; 10lb higher but can never be ignored under these conditions
runners.name: Without Compromise
runners.spotlight: Record over C&D reads 412131, his latest success a 6l victory over Inappropriate 19 days ago; handicapper hasn't missed him with a 10lb rise and he takes on much better rivals this time, but he can never be ignored under these conditions.

runners.comment: Five wins here and running well lately, but still 6lb above his last winning mark
runners.name: Urban Road
runners.owner: S Mcmillan, F Reay & A D Brown
runners.spotlight: Five-time course winner who has continued to run well since completing a hat-trick on Tapeta last February, including when a close third of ten at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) a fortnight ago; still 6lb above his last winning mark, though, so will need a bit extra.

runners.comment: Would have finished closer to Without Compromise over C&D last time with a clearer run
runners.name: Inappropriate
runners.spotlight: Two wins on turf and two over hurdles; beaten 6l by Without Compromise in a first-time tongue-tie over C&D 19 days ago, but would have finished closer with a clearer run; 9lb better off with the winner and can't be dismissed easily.

15:34.race_name: Midnite Are Upping The Betting Game Handicap

runners.comment: Still on last winning mark, but another furlong may suit ideally having won over 6f here
runners.name: Mesaafi
runners.spotlight: Still on his last winning mark and running consistently well in defeat lately; has run well over 5f, but another furlong may suit ideally having won over that trip on his only previous visit here.

runners.comment: Well held on handicap debut at Lingfield last month; has something to prove
runners.name: Coronado King
runners.spotlight: Made a successful stable debut following a mammoth absence in a Wolverhampton maiden (6f, Tapeta) in October having been gelded in the meantime, but well held on handicap debut at Lingfield (6f, Polytrack) last month; something to prove.

runners.comment: Not shown much in just four starts since winning at Cork in April 2023; look elsewhere
runners.name: Pineapple Island
runners.spotlight: Not shown much in just four starts for three different yards since winning a Cork maiden (5f, soft to heavy) in April 2023, including when well beaten here (6f) on Monday; look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Still 7lb higher than when off the mark over C&D in October
runners.name: Bonnies Boy
runners.spotlight: Made it 14th-time lucky over C&D in October, but an 8lb rise for that has appeared to find him out in both starts since; 1lb drop not enough to tempt.

runners.breeder: Executors Of The Late Mr J L C Pearce
runners.comment: Rarely seen over 5f; can go well fresh but losing run up to 25
runners.name: Juan Les Pins
runners.spotlight: Finished runner-up in a Southwell Listed race (5f, Tapeta) in February 2024, but mainly seen over further; has run well fresh in the past so a four-month absence may not be as much of a concern as a 25-race losing run.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner and runner-up here last month; very much respected
runners.name: Kings Crown
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner, the latest in November, while he again ran well when second of ten here 19 days ago with two of these behind; up another 3lb but still very much respected; stable also runs Darlo Pride.

runners.comment: Both course wins have come over 6f; still needs more to defy this mark
runners.name: Dandy Magic
runners.spotlight: Both course wins have come over 6f, though she did win over this trip at Ayr (good to soft) in September; may have sat too close to the pace here 13 days ago, but still needs more in order to defy this mark for last year's winning stable.

runners.comment: 6lb below last winning mark but doesn't come into this in great form; others more solid
runners.name: Lions House
runners.spotlight: 6lb lower than when winning at Southwell (5f, Tapeta) in May, but doesn't come into this in the best of form; others more solid.

runners.comment: Two of his four wins have come over C&D; each-way player if they go hard up front
runners.name: Dark Kestrel
runners.spotlight: Two of his four wins have come over C&D, the latest off 2lb lower in October; each-way player, especially if they go hard up front.

runners.comment: Returned to winning form over C&D in November, but held back here 11 days later
runners.name: Blue Lakota
runners.spotlight: Returned to winning form when just getting the better of a subsequent scorer over C&D in November, but held off this mark back here 11 days later; needs a resurgence.

runners.comment: 3lb higher than when winning narrowly over C&D last month; may be able to build on that
runners.name: Hover On The Wind
runners.spotlight: Handy sort who narrowly regained winning form over C&D last month; 3lb higher, but he was returning from 72 days off last time so he may be able to build on that performance.

runners.comment: C&D winner; ran well after a layoff when fourth behind Hover On The Wind here last month
runners.name: Darlo Pride
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And M Dods
runners.spotlight: 2lb higher than for the latest of two wins around this time last year (first was over C&D); was returning from 258 days off when beaten just over 2l into fourth of nine behind Hover On The Wind here last month; one for the shortlist with that run under his belt.

16:05.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.comment: Off four months before an encouraging C&D third latest; one to consider now
runners.name: Callianassa
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D scorer in the summer who resumed from four months off with an encouraging third of eight over C&D 12 days ago, fading late on; she's one to consider with that run under her belt.

runners.comment: Hinted at a revival for new yard when eighth at Wolverhampton 12 days ago; not discounted
runners.name: Qazaq
runners.spotlight: A fairly useful 1m winner at his best for Roger Varian; tongue tied and hinted at a revival for his new yard when eighth of 12 in 7f Wolverhampton handicap 12 days ago, set a lot to do; he's not discounted off a falling mark.

runners.comment: Arrives in decent nick, third at Southwell 20 days ago; ought to be thereabouts once more
runners.name: Donna Nook
runners.spotlight: Yet to score for her current handler but this fair ex-Irish 7f winner arrives in decent nick, cheekpieces on when third of six in 1m Southwell handicap 20 days ago; she ought to be thereabouts once more.

runners.comment: On a losing run but he comes here in good form; one for the shortlist with cheekpieces on
runners.name: Eves Boy
runners.spotlight: On a losing run but he comes here in good form, fifth of ten in 1m Southwell handicap 41 days ago; one for the shortlist with cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Thriving for current yard and gained third win here latest; up 4lb but not taken lightly
runners.name: The Green Man
runners.spotlight: Thriving for his current yard and he bagged a third success here in 7f handicap 19 days ago; up another 4lb but not taken lightly stepped up in trip.

runners.comment: Collared only late on when second here 12 days ago; can go well again despite 2lb rise
runners.name: Bajan Bandit
runners.spotlight: Resumed winning ways over 7f here in December and twice runner-up here since, collared only late on in 7f handicap 12 days ago; he can go well again despite a 2lb weights rise.

runners.comment: Shaped well when C&D second 12 days ago; this course scorer merits serious consideration
runners.name: Flying Fletcher
runners.spotlight: On a lengthy losing sequence but he's slipped in the weights and shaped well when second of eight over C&D 12 days ago when conceding first run to the winner; this course scorer merits serious consideration off an unchanged mark.

runners.comment: Set plenty to do when good sixth here latest; ought to be in the shake-up off easing mark
runners.name: Novak
runners.spotlight: Scored over 7f here in September and has continued in good form, set plenty to do when sixth of 12 over 6f here 13 days ago; he ought to be in the shake-up off a slipping mark.

runners.comment: Goes really well here and readily landed fifth win over C&D latest; good claims
runners.name: Concert Boy
runners.owner: Making Headway Racing And K Scott
runners.spotlight: Goes really well here and garnered a fifth win in impressive style over C&D 23 days ago, forging clear last 1f; hiked up 9lb but still holds good claims.

runners.comment: In fine form for current yard, best of the front-runners when C&D third latest; a player
runners.name: Francesi
runners.spotlight: Quick to make his mark for his current yard over C&D in December and he fared best of the pace-setters when third of 12 over C&D only three days ago; a player off the same mark.

16:35.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Four-time C&D winner but essentially below his best here and elsewhere since the autumn.
runners.name: Volenti
runners.spotlight: Four-time C&D winner but essentially below his best here and elsewhere since the autumn, losing his race in the preliminaries last time; weighted to strike again, if not a certainty to do so.

runners.comment: Finishing effort wasn't all it could be behind No Nay Nevermind over 7f here latest.
runners.name: Sherlock
runners.spotlight: In the frame on all four starts since an autumn break, albeit twice beaten as favourite; finishing effort wasn't all it could be behind No Nay Nevermind over 7f here latest; cheekpieces debuted then are retained.

runners.comment: November's C&D win was another personal best form effort; chance if all's well with him.
runners.name: Coramento
runners.spotlight: Win here in early November was another clear personal best form effort (RPR 64) and took his C&D handicap record to 1341; yet to strike in better than 0-58 company and he missed his last intended engagement through lameness, but claims are obvious if all is well with him.

runners.comment: Traffic issues over 7f here latest; now at least returned to his sole winning mark.
runners.name: Miners Gamble
runners.spotlight: Traffic issues galore when dropped to a 7f trip no longer within his range here last time; will still need it to all fall right back up just a furlong, but has been returned to his sole winning mark, at least.

runners.comment: Could help himself more, but mark continues to fall; may yet have a race on Tapeta in him.
runners.name: Springbok
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.spotlight: Not always been helping himself of late (can take a grip; hung right latest), but now 17lb lower than for April's handicap debut and his best RPR away from turf was gained over 1m on his sole previous Tapeta start.

runners.comment: Offered little on last month's Tapeta debut at Southwell, but might prefer this course.
runners.name: Believe In Lies
runners.spotlight: Offered little on last month's Tapeta debut at Southwell, but as her strongest handicap form thus far has been recorded over galloping turf tracks the hope must be she'll find this place more to her liking.

runners.comment: Outstayed Sherlock when second over 7f in the second-time visor here latest; chance.
runners.name: No Nay Nevermind
runners.owner: S Jones, L Donaldson, K Elliott & I Codd
runners.spotlight: 0-14 but competitive again since the visor was added, staying on past Sherlock over 7f here latest in such a manner as to suggest today's trip may be within compass now; back up 2lb but likelier than many.

runners.comment: More prolific on turf; hasn't beaten a rival on two recent C&D visits; hood reached for.
runners.name: Shifter
runners.spotlight: More prolific on turf but missed nearly all of that season in 2025, and hasn't beaten a rival on two recent C&D visits; hood reached for.

runners.comment: Multiple C&D winner; emerged from the doldrums when third here 12 days ago (run of race).
runners.name: Pallas Lord
runners.spotlight: C&D winner off up to 6lb higher in the past, and emerged from the doldrums with a resurgent third here 12 days ago, granted the run of the race; goes close again if able to back up that effort.

runners.comment: Slow start likely cost him another C&D win latest; can figure if this is also run to suit.
runners.name: Trais Fluors
runners.spotlight: A nose away from a fourth C&D win last time, a slow start proving costly; always a hostage to fortune given his preferred hold-up style, but evidently in the form currently to figure again if this is run to suit.

runners.comment: 0-10 and unimproved by the step up to this C&D behind Sherlock last time out; overlooked.
runners.name: Wait For It
runners.spotlight: 0-10 and unimproved by the step up to this C&D latest, trailing Sherlock 7l; 5lb swing with that one isn't sufficiently persuasive.

17:05.race_name: Midnite: Built For 2025 Not 2005 Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: On dangerous mark and he turned things around with close third C&D 12 days ago; respected
runners.name: Master Dandy
runners.spotlight: On lengthy losing run but he's well treated on old form and showed signs of a revival when close third over C&D 12 days ago; that was a bold bid from the front and he's a big player if he can back that up.

runners.comment: Went close over C&D last month but well held in both subsequent runs and she's now 0-13
runners.name: Sovereign Class
runners.spotlight: Reappeared with a near miss over C&D last month but she's not come close to that form in two subsequent runs and is now 0-13; down the list.

runners.comment: Inconsistent 12-race maiden who has form figures of 5488 at this trip; opposable on return
runners.name: Auntie Jo
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent 12-race maiden who was a well-held fifth of seven at Ayr (5f, good) when last seen in April; mark continues to fall but she has form figures of 5488 at this trip and looks opposable on her return.

runners.comment: 0-10 but he's unexposed on AW and wasn't beaten far over C&D two weeks ago
runners.name: Eco Power Boy
runners.spotlight: 0-10 but he's dropped a long way in the weights and wasn't beaten far on his reappearance over C&D (fifth of 14) two weeks ago; has each-way claims if he can build on that and he's unexposed on AW.

runners.comment: Both wins have come at big prices and she needs another bolt from the blue
runners.name: Green Valentine
runners.spotlight: 25-1 winner at Hamilton (6f, soft) in September and she scored at 66-1 over C&D last month; remains feasibly treated on her best form but she's been laboured in last two runs and needs another bolt from the blue; cheekpieces removed.

runners.comment: Won a classified event over C&D in March; needs watching in market on his return
runners.name: Doon The Glen
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 25th attempt when finishing well to score by a nose over C&D (classified event) in March; has 4lb rise to deal with back in a handicap but that was a personal best last time and he needs watching in market on his return.

runners.comment: 11-time course winner and he was a good second over C&D last time; in the mix
runners.name: Athollblair Boy
runners.spotlight: 12yo who has won 11 times at this track; last win was almost two years ago but that was off 16lb higher and he bounced back with a good second over C&D last month; regular cheekpieces now return and he's in the mix.

runners.comment: Seven-time course winner who has finished placed here in last three runs; respected
runners.name: Spartan Fighter
runners.owner: John And Tony Jarvis And Partner
runners.spotlight: Losing run is up to 22 but this seven-time course winner has finished placed here in his last three runs including when runner-up over C&D two weeks ago; that was a good effort behind a handicap blot and he's respected off unchanged mark.

runners.comment: Regressive nine-race maiden who has form figures of 400977 in handicaps; others preferred
runners.name: Brave Bob
runners.spotlight: Generally regressive nine-race maiden who has form figures of 400977 in handicaps; still unexposed on AW but mark has bottomed out now and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Some good efforts over C&D since October but she's a frequent slow starter who is now 0-18
runners.name: Yellow Lemons
runners.spotlight: Some creditable efforts over C&D since October but she's a frequent slow starter who is not easy to predict and her record now stands at 0-18.

runners.comment: Just one win from 30 starts and she's struggled in her last two runs
runners.name: Shesashambles
runners.spotlight: Just one win from 30 starts and that was at Thirsk in August 2024; reached the frame a couple of times over C&D in the autumn but she's struggled in last two starts and needs a major revival; cheekpieces reapplied.

runners.comment: Last win was over two years ago and he's been out of sorts over C&D in last three runs
runners.name: Bernie The Bear
runners.spotlight: All three wins have been on Tapeta (6f/7f) but last success was over two years ago and he's been out of sorts over C&D in last three runs; passed over.

17:35.race_name: Midnite: Built For 2025 Not 2005 Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: In good form until caught wide at Chelmsford latest; likely player eased 1lb
runners.name: Diligent Henry
runners.spotlight: Won at Wolverhampton (7f) in October and in good form until caught wide at Chelmsford (7f) four weeks ago; likely player eased 1lb.

runners.comment: Beat just one over C&D on his yard debut 27 days ago; needs to take a major step forward
runners.name: Classy Clarets
runners.spotlight: Ended his time with Alice Haynes well below par and beat just one over C&D on his yard debut 27 days ago; needs to take a major step forward.

runners.comment: Rusty after six months off when seventh here latest; considered with blinkers back on
runners.name: Beneficiary
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who looked rusty after six months off when a never-dangerous seventh of 11 in 5f handicap here 23 days ago; needs considering now with his usual blinkers also back on.

runners.comment: Not seen to ideal effect when C&D sixth latest; this C&D scorer is one for the shortlist
runners.name: Laurens Dream
runners.spotlight: It's now 15 runs since her last success but she wasn't seen to ideal effect when sixth of 14 over C&D 16 days ago, challenging wide; this C&D scorer is one for the shortlist.

runners.comment: Still a maiden but back on track when fourth over C&D 12 days ago; needs to back it up
runners.name: Penny Mountain
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but she got back on track when fourth of 12 over C&D 12 days ago; she needs to back it up now.

runners.comment: C&D success in November but well below par here both runs since; headgear changed now
runners.name: Korroor
runners.spotlight: Gained a second C&D success in November but has been well below par here both runs since; needs a change of headgear to spark a resurgence.

runners.comment: Course specialist who got right back on track with C&D second latest; not taken lightly
runners.name: Fircombe Hall
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run but this course specialist got right back on track when second of 12 over C&D 12 days ago; he's not taken lightly nudged up 1lb.

runners.comment: Had wind op before only 13th over C&D 16 days ago; lots more is needed to get off the mark
runners.name: Wee Nan
runners.spotlight: Had a wind op before coming in only 13th in C&D handicap 16 days ago; lots more is needed if she's to get off the mark at the sixth attempt.

runners.comment: A three-time C&D winner but he comes here well below par; others appeal more
runners.name: Nazca
runners.spotlight: A three-time C&D winner but he comes here well below par, just eighth of 14 over C&D 23 days ago; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Course scorer; not discredited when C&D fourth latest; 21 starts since that win though
runners.name: Yaahobby
runners.spotlight: Course winner who wasn't discredited when fourth of 14 over C&D 16 days ago; it's 21 starts since that victory though.

runners.comment: Last here in September on final run for Neil Mechie; needs yard switch to spark progress
runners.name: Auroras Doublesix
runners.spotlight: Poor maiden who was tried in a hood when last of ten in 7f handicap here in September on her final run for Neil Mechie; needs this yard switch to spark major improvement.

12:20.race_name: Happy New Year Novices' Hurdle (Go North Night Nurse Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Had to work pretty hard to beat a 50-1 chance over C&D in November; penalised
runners.name: Silver Hill
runners.spotlight: Had to work pretty hard to beat a 50-1 chance over C&D (good) in November when long odds-on; he'll need to find something on that form if he's to defy a penalty.

runners.breeder: Haras Du Hoguenet & Mr Gilles Le Baron
runners.comment: Point and Southwell bumper winner; appeared stretched by 2m7f on soft ground last time
runners.name: In The Age
runners.spotlight: Irish point and Southwell bumper winner (good to soft); ran as though his hurdling debut at Aintree (2m4f) would bring him on and perhaps was stretched by 2m7f on soft ground at Bangor since; leading claims.

runners.comment: Has every chance on the form he's reached and may well improve for this longer trip
runners.name: Pioneer Pete
runners.spotlight: Consistent so far without looking overly progressive but has bumped into some useful rivals; should have every chance on the form he's reached and may well improve for this longer trip.

runners.comment: Beaten 19l and 39l in his two bumpers and wouldn't be the obvious answer to this
runners.name: Ratemenow
runners.spotlight: Beaten 19l and 39l in his two bumpers and wouldn't be the obvious answer to this.

runners.comment: Has the stamina for hurdling but unlikely the ability to cope with today's opposition
runners.name: Inlet
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden on the Flat, although she finished runner-up three times; has the stamina for hurdling but unlikely the ability to cope with today's opposition; sold for 6,000gns in November; stable debut.

runners.comment: £1,600 3yo; 250-1 when pulled up over C&D 16 days ago; no appeal
runners.name: Lady Lucky
runners.spotlight: £1,600 3yo; 250-1 when pulled up over C&D 16 days ago; no appeal.

12:55.race_name: Book The Great Value Horseshoe Package Handicap Chase

runners.comment: C&D winner; shaped well after an absence two months ago and since had wind op
runners.name: Imperial Rule
runners.owner: Mrs K Elliott, Mrs D Chapman & Partner
runners.spotlight: The winner of three handicap chases at about this trip, the latest over C&D in November 2024; was returning from 335 days off and making stable debut when beaten about 9l behind El Muchacho at Sedgefield (2m5f, good); has had a wind op since and could be sharper now.

runners.comment: Sedgefield winner in November but pretty poor either side of that; hard to trust
runners.name: El Muchacho
runners.owner: T J Stubbins And M E Sowersby
runners.spotlight: Narrowly won off 2lb lower at Sedgefield in November (2m5f, good; Imperial Rule third) but pretty poor either side of that; capable but too inconsistent to trust.

runners.comment: Below par since his Cartmel win in May but still commands respect in this weak handicap
runners.name: Defence Witness
runners.spotlight: Narrowly repelled Beat The Edge at Cartmel (2m5f, good to soft) in May but below that level in two subsequent runs and his latest third here was remote; still commands respect in this weak handicap.

runners.comment: Disappointing here last Sunday, for all that he was hampered at one stage
runners.name: Beat The Edge
runners.spotlight: 0-13 since beating three rivals in this race 12 months ago and was behind both El Muchacho and Imperial Rule at Sedgefield in November; disappointing here last Sunday, for all that he was hampered at one stage.

13:30.race_name: Bet At Racing TV Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Very limited Flat maiden who was a remote fifth on hurdling debut in October
runners.name: Apache Eagle
runners.spotlight: Very limited Flat maiden who was a remote fifth on hurdling debut at Newcastle in October.

runners.comment: Quite useful Flat performer (4-34) and won his penultimate race over 1m2f
runners.name: Have Secret
runners.spotlight: Quite useful Flat performer (4-34) and won his penultimate race over 1m2f at Redcar in November; if he can last home over this trip then his ability is hugely respected.

runners.breeder: Mme I Garcon, Mr J-Pierre Garcon & Mr G
runners.comment: First run for this yard was encouraging but not the latest when back at Carlisle
runners.name: Inedit Damour
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles/fences in France; quite a promising third on yard debut at Carlisle (2m1f, soft) but fared less well there one month ago with cheekpieces back on; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Tailed off in a Tipperary bumper on good to yielding in May; new trainer fits a hood
runners.name: Intenzo
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a Tipperary bumper on good to yielding in May; new trainer fits a hood; would need to see some market confidence behind him.

runners.comment: Bumper winner; only 100-30 when departing three out at Huntingdon
runners.name: Not For Passin
runners.spotlight: Easy winner of a five-runner Perth bumper (good ground) and later recruited for 60,000euros; only 100-30 when departing three out at Huntingdon when in midfield at the time; one of the better options.

runners.comment: Although turned over at 5-4 at Huntingdon, the winner has proven himself a good horse
runners.name: Unjeu Royal
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; had an excuse on hurdle debut and, although turned over at 5-4 at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft), the winner went on to finish second to the exciting Old Park Star at Cheltenham before finishing behind in Aintree's Grade 1 on Boxing Day; this gelding faces nothing of his calibre here.

runners.breeder: Newsells Park & Ammerland Gmbh & Co Kg
runners.comment: 0-6 on Flat and didn't really progress; bled from nose when pulled up on hurdling debut
runners.name: William Walton
runners.spotlight: Showed ability during six-race Flat career for Owen Burrows, though was tailed off in cheekpieces on final run for that yard; bled from the nose when pulled up on stable/hurdling debut at Stratford; risky.

runners.comment: Her first real blip in bumpers when well beaten in a Listed race last time
runners.name: Dotties Promise
runners.owner: Castle View Racing & W F Corbett
runners.spotlight: Her first real blip in bumpers when well beaten in a Listed race last time; won at Kelso on good ground in September; others have greater substance to their credentials.

14:05.race_name: racingtv.com Handicap Chase (Go North One Man Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Easy winner here on Sunday and found another weak race in which to carry a penalty
runners.name: Supreme George
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-2 after wind surgery when beating three other finishers with ease over C&D (good) last Sunday; must have every chance of defying a penalty in another weak race.

runners.breeder: Pierre De Maleissye Melun & Terry Amos
runners.comment: Last seen in June 2023 when doubling his tally over fences in a 2m4f handicap at Southwell
runners.name: Coupdebol
runners.spotlight: Last seen in June 2023 when doubling his tally over fences in a 2m4f handicap at Southwell (good; same mark); whether he's the same force now has to be questionable.

runners.breeder: Dr V Roger-Yves Simon Et Al
runners.comment: 0-6 over fences; two quiet runs over hurdles since joining current yard
runners.name: Starman
runners.spotlight: Did well in Ireland but lost his way last season and nothing positive to take from his two runs for current yard; returns to fences here (0-6) and hard to be at all confident.

runners.comment: Has a bit to prove after his recent efforts, but he is a dual C&D winner
runners.name: Treaty Boy
runners.spotlight: In contention when brought down at the second-last at Kelso (2m1f, good) in October; beaten 15l into second next time so that was a backward step and lesser runs followed; has a bit to prove but he is a dual C&D winner.

runners.comment: She's due a 2lb drop and 5lb out of the weights, so essentially 7lb wrong
runners.name: Zaras Universe
runners.spotlight: Ran respectably at Southwell two runs back but disappointing either side of that run; she's due a 2lb drop and 5lb out of the weights, so essentially 7lb wrong.

14:40.race_name: Download The Raceday Ready App Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Goes well here in both codes; only weakened out of it late on over C&D 16 days ago
runners.name: Bollin Neil
runners.spotlight: Goes well here on the Flat and over jumps; only weakened out of it late on over C&D (good to soft) 16 days ago; should run well.

runners.comment: Back on a good mark but will need to improve plenty on his last three efforts
runners.name: The Wise Traveller
runners.spotlight: Has dipped 1lb beneath the mark he won off at Plumpton in September (3m1f, good) but will need to step up on his subsequent efforts under similar conditions.

runners.comment: Winning hurdler; quiet stable debut on ground that was perhaps too soft on chase debut
runners.name: Lathan
runners.spotlight: Won a match over hurdles for Rebecca Menzies last season and wasn't beaten too far in a 2m4f handicap (good); pulled up on final run for that yard and ran poorly on debut for this one, though that was his chase debut on ground that was perhaps too soft.

runners.comment: Beaten 11l on soft last time over 3m; could last longer under these conditions
runners.name: Coral Blue
runners.spotlight: Exposed five-time winner over hurdles; all his best form is over shorter but he didn't run too badly over 3m at Musselburgh (soft; from the front) and could last longer under these conditions.

runners.comment: Modest last run but had previously been placed in 3m1f/2m3f handicaps at Hereford
runners.name: Knightsbridge
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced; placed in 3m1f/2m3f good-ground handicaps at Hereford before a lesser show at Taunton (3m); probably has a race in him off this mark.

runners.comment: Won 2m7f handicap in 2024 but finished tailed off in 2m5f/3m1f handicaps after a year out
runners.name: Twoplacesatonetime
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m7f handicap at Hexham in 2024 but has finished tailed off in 2m5f/3m1f handicaps at Sedgefield and here after a year out.

runners.comment: On a good mark and finally perked up when a 4l third over C&D 16 days ago
runners.name: Rebel Intentions
runners.spotlight: Struggled on his final few runs for Emma Lavelle but finally perked up when a 4l third over C&D (good to soft) 16 days ago and his last win was off 15lb higher.

runners.comment: Nearly won an Irish point so could improve for this stiffer stamina test on handicap debut
runners.name: Reliance Kid
runners.spotlight: Thoroughly tailed off in his three races over hurdles at up to 2m3f, but he did nearly win an Irish point at 3m so could improve for this stiffer stamina test on handicap debut.

runners.comment: An eight-race maiden and was tailed off at Newcastle last month after a break
runners.name: King Casey
runners.spotlight: Finished an 11l fourth of nine in a novice handicap at Market Rasen (3m, good) in June but was tailed off at Newcastle last month after a break; not that convincing.

runners.comment: 3m winner off 3lb lower; respectable efforts the last twice and has each-way claims
runners.name: East Eagle
runners.owner: Mrs Janet Cooper & M E Sowersby
runners.spotlight: Sole win in 18 starts came over 3m at Southwell last April off 3lb lower; respectable efforts the last twice and has each-way claims.

runners.comment: Seems very hit and miss and has yet to convince over this sort of trip
runners.name: Matoury
runners.spotlight: Won off a similar mark at Market Rasen (2m4f, good) in June but seems very hit and miss and has yet to convince over this sort of trip.

runners.comment: Two seconds on good ground before an excusable defeat on heavy a month ago
runners.name: Zeezee
runners.spotlight: Runner-up at Perth (3m) and Sedgefield (2m5f; again on good) before an excusable defeat on heavy one month ago; definite chance back on good ground with cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Both wins under rules were in 2022 and very opposable on this season's form
runners.name: West Lawn
runners.spotlight: Both wins under rules came over slightly shorter trips at Hexham in 2022; very opposable on this season's form.

runners.breeder: E A R L Pestour, C Pestour & N Pestour
runners.comment: Has a strike-rate of 1-35, arrives here in no form and he's 2lb out of the weights
runners.name: Foxs Socks
runners.spotlight: Has a strike-rate of 1-35, arrives here in no form and he's 2lb out of the weights.

runners.comment: No wins in ten starts but ran one of her better races when 8l off the winner at Wetherby
runners.name: Fancy Nancy Pants
runners.spotlight: No wins in ten starts but she ran one of her better races when 8l off the winner at Wetherby (3m, soft) five days ago; possibilities despite being 2lb wrong.

runners.comment: This is easier than last time and he's on a good mark if able to recapture some form
runners.name: Byron Hill
runners.spotlight: Didn't last long over fences and failed to fire on a recent return to hurdling; however, this is easier and he's on a good mark if able to recapture some form.

runners.comment: Went up 8lb for winning at Sedgefield but still ran well in defeat at Musselburgh
runners.name: John Betjeman
runners.spotlight: High-mileage veteran; went up 8lb for his successful debut for this yard at Sedgefield (2m1f, soft) but still ran well at Musselburgh and could easily have finished closer; considered.

runners.comment: Form lacks substance but could still be interesting for respected yard now handicapping
runners.name: Killycarn
runners.spotlight: Only five ran when third at Sedgefield (2m1f, soft) and tailed off either side of that; could still be interesting for a respected yard now moving into handicaps.

runners.comment: Pulled up on return to hurdling in November but has the form to feature in this
runners.name: Bodygroove
runners.spotlight: 1m6f Flat winner who won over hurdles at Wetherby early last year off 1lb lower; did pull up on his return to hurdling in November but couldn't rule out.

runners.comment: 0-8 over hurdles but was close up at Market Rasen last time despite racing freely
runners.name: Wind Your Neck In
runners.spotlight: Three Flat wins; 0-8 over hurdles but was close up at Market Rasen (2m, good to soft) last time despite racing freely; has some sort of chance.

runners.comment: Won only previous hurdle run in 2023; competitive on the Flat in 2025
runners.name: Gozo
runners.spotlight: Useful Flat maiden who won a juvenile hurdle at Plumpton in 2023 on sole previous run over jumps; not at his best on the Flat in 2025 but ran okay; wouldn't be without hope on this belated return to hurdles on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Never figured last time after a wind operation and he's moved yards for 5,500gns since
runners.name: Character Testing
runners.spotlight: AW winner; has placed form over hurdles but never figured last time after a wind operation and he's moved yards for 5,500gns since.

runners.comment: Latest below-par run was only a day after winning at Uttoxeter; still on a good mark
runners.name: Cawthorne Banker
runners.spotlight: Has won handicaps at Fontwell and Uttoxeter (about 2m1f; good to soft and good) this season; his lesser effort at Stratford (subsequently disqualified after rider failed to weigh in) was just one day after that last success and can be forgiven; remains well handicapped on older form.

runners.comment: Well held on recent Flat start; only 1-13 over hurdles but he's down to very workable mark
runners.name: Lahire
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on the Flat 13 days ago after two months off; only 1-13 over hurdles but he's down to a very workable mark.

runners.comment: Dual Flat winner but has an unconvincing record over hurdles (0-6) and others preferred
runners.name: Susiesparkle
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner but has an unconvincing record over hurdles (0-6) and others are preferred.
